Personally i do not like remove exited containers in a post-deploy task, i prefer a clean task rather that remove non working containers in a post-deploy. How debug an issue if container does not exists?'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2017-02-13 13:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

why should remove the exited container and untag image?'}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2017-03-31 01:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Personally i do not like remove exited containers in a post-deploy
 > task, i prefer a clean task rather that remove non working
 > containers in a post-deploy. How debug an issue if container does
 > not exists?
The meaning of this is that if you deploy it many times, there may be some exit state containers, they are of no use and need to be cleared.
If you have problems with the deployment process, the deployment will be interrupted, will not run deploy-post, so it does not affect your debugging bug.'}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2017-03-31 01:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > Personally i do not like remove exited containers in a
 > post-deploy
 > > task, i prefer a clean task rather that remove non working
 > > containers in a post-deploy. How debug an issue if container does
 > > not exists?
 > The meaning of this is that if you deploy it many times, there may
 > be some exit state containers, they are of no use and need to be
 > cleared.
 > If you have problems with the deployment process, the deployment
 > will be interrupted, will not run deploy-post, so it does not
 > affect your debugging bug.

Because if you build images in the deployment node, there will be some untagged images on the deployment node, its waste hard disk space.'}, {'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2017-03-31 09:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add remove-garbage function in kolla-ansible

The purpose of this function is remove exited containers on target node
and untagged images on the deploy node. This function is added when
performing "kolla-ansible post-deploy" command.
The remove-exited-containers and remove-untagged-images script to achieve
the main function.

Change-Id: I24b715796de6d9a2ea1409acd4c4373d4ae8dc74
Closes-Bug: #1644748

commit_message:
Remove intree tempest tests

New project congress-tempest-plugin is created, so removing the intree
tempest tests repo

Implements blueprint split-tempest-plugin
Change-Id: Iab440c040453d0ec6a886bf8a0096b566c9ff10b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I37571f8af87d8bf517a099334a4bf6fe262807ac

commit_message:
Improve validation of res limit for RG

With this change if resource count in nested stack
exceeds limit, stack will not start creating and
user gets according message.

Change-Id: Ia31269abca044898934c944ee7ff768e24d11de0
Closes-bug: #1618073

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 03:57:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove legacy-devstack-dsvm-py35-updown from devstack

We are currently running both python3.5 and 2.7 versions of the
"updown" test (this brings up devstack, then runs ./unstack.sh as a
closing hook).

We run legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35 as part of integrated-gate-py35; so
this python3.5 updown job isn't really exercising anything different,
and mostly just duplicates the 2.7 updown job.

As we're moving everything to native jobs slowly anyway, I think we
can just remove the python3.5 job to simplify that.

Change-Id: I62b2ca20a3ed0f1938c1212a5d2652e513a7cfce
'}]
commit_message:
Remove legacy-devstack-dsvm-py35-updown from devstack

We are currently running both python3.5 and 2.7 versions of the
"updown" test (this brings up devstack, then runs ./unstack.sh as a
closing hook).

We run legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35 as part of integrated-gate-py35; so
this python3.5 updown job isn't really exercising anything different,
and mostly just duplicates the 2.7 updown job.

As we're moving everything to native jobs slowly anyway, I think we
can just remove the python3.5 job to simplify that.

Change-Id: I62b2ca20a3ed0f1938c1212a5d2652e513a7cfce

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 6882, 'name': 'Thomas SJ Kang', 'display_name': 'ujuc', 'email': 'community@ujuc.me', 'username': 'sungjin'}, {'_account_id': 14482, 'name': 'Ian Y. Choi', 'email': 'ianyrchoi@gmail.com', 'username': 'ianychoi'}, {'_account_id': 17765, 'name': 'Frank Kloeker', 'email': 'f.kloeker@telekom.de', 'username': 'eumel8'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2017-08-15 06:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-15 07:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-i18n-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/63/493763/1/check/gate-i18n-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/e2d5e76/ : SUCCESS in 3m 52s
- gate-i18n-tox-doc-publish-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/63/493763/1/check/gate-i18n-tox-doc-publish-docs/5f6e422//publish-docs/i18n/latest : SUCCESS in 3m 35s'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-08-15 08:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Honestly I cannot understand the motivation. I wonder what is the use case of this docker image.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2017-08-15 11:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2017-08-17 14:55:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

hi @Akihiro sang

sorry, my reply is late.

We have a translation sprint on Pycon Korea 2017 this Tuesday.
However, participants did not contribute translation and spent too much time setting up the environment.
So I created a Doker image. I wanted to create a simple environment where I could run my own translations or modified scripts.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-08-20 15:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Sungjin for clarification.

IMHO there is no need to merge this patch unless the i18n team maintains a docker file. If we want to have it in the repository, I think we need a README file which describes what is this and what are required assumptions. For example, I am sure what docker image is assumed as the default image (git is always installed?)

I am happy to remove my -1 if other i18n team members want to have this in the repo. Until then I hold my -1.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2017-10-02 21:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

As amotoki already mentioned there are no requirements for a docker image, at least documentation and use cases are missing.
@ujuc: Let us know if you want to prepare this permanent (maybe for the next event) and please provide some documentation. 
Or abondon the change :-)'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-02-06 05:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

no more action needed in this prooposal.'}]

subject: Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-02-06 02:50:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks for your patch!'}, {'account_id': 19224, 'date': '2018-02-06 05:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:15:16.000000000', 'message': 'Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I877e0a3703fa13b52e1df79f20c580b2604e7d1c
Closes-Bug: #1747453
'}]
commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I877e0a3703fa13b52e1df79f20c580b2604e7d1c
Closes-Bug: #1747453

subject: Allow escalation of UUID validation warning to error
messages:
[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-02-02 11:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-02-05 13:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

thanks'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 11:22:03.000000000', 'message': "Allow escalation of UUID validation warning to error

Today UUIDField emits a warning if the provided value is not a valid
UUID. However this warning cannot be escalated to an exception through
the standard warnings module because the validation code also adds a
warning filter to the warning filter list that overrides the existing
filters.

This patch ensures that the 'once' warning filter only added to the
end of the filter list. This way if the client has already specified
another filter for this warning (e.g. and error filter) then that
filter will not be overriden.

Change-Id: I17cb96d16fcd91195478b738fbdda01b47cfd69d
Closes-Bug: #1746966
"}]
commit_message:
Allow escalation of UUID validation warning to error

Today UUIDField emits a warning if the provided value is not a valid
UUID. However this warning cannot be escalated to an exception through
the standard warnings module because the validation code also adds a
warning filter to the warning filter list that overrides the existing
filters.

This patch ensures that the 'once' warning filter only added to the
end of the filter list. This way if the client has already specified
another filter for this warning (e.g. and error filter) then that
filter will not be overriden.

Change-Id: I17cb96d16fcd91195478b738fbdda01b47cfd69d
Closes-Bug: #1746966

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in post

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of POST in SchedulerReportClient.
When creating a resource provider and creating a resource class,
the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: I39d8c71432b3adf7e5bdde1c6cb6f089a9c79614
Partial-Bug: #1734625

commit_message:
to_kv_list util handles value with slice/list type

Previously to_kv_list assumes that all values happen to be string type. In this
commit we are taking care of values which are also type list/slice. In future
commits we will have to take care of values which are also of type dicts

Change-Id: Ie670c91d9880638d04cadf2acc32e7aa0400ca2c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 18:16:13.000000000', 'message': 'Remove MongoDB integration and transform to using POI resources

This patch removes MongoDB beaker tests as this is not a well
tested use-case and sticks to the Swift/SQLalchemy configuration
which is well tested.  It switches Beaker to use the same resources
in integration.

Depends-On: Ic1a4ea20ef65a832a986964fb61e80c4738740b5
Change-Id: I9796a7bb2f25a2df53a1aeeb2814a91ca2c2cbec
'}]
commit_message:
Remove MongoDB integration and transform to using POI resources

This patch removes MongoDB beaker tests as this is not a well
tested use-case and sticks to the Swift/SQLalchemy configuration
which is well tested.  It switches Beaker to use the same resources
in integration.

Depends-On: Ic1a4ea20ef65a832a986964fb61e80c4738740b5
Change-Id: I9796a7bb2f25a2df53a1aeeb2814a91ca2c2cbec

'}]
commit_message:
Correct security group pull down option

Key of security groups in pull down options is mistaken
in singular format. Correct it to match plural format.

Change-Id: Ib569418f767e4b94ecd9fbc90e8e08f932735abd

commit_message:
Trivial fix a missleading comment

The comment for new volume detach workflow in rebuild instance
seems incorrect and missleading, the empty attachment is create
to prevent volume status turn to `available`, not `in-use`.

[{'created': '2017-12-22 14:31:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove r10k env vars with proper args

The PUPPETFILE and PUPPETFILE_DIR environment
variables are deprecated since several releases
and are superseeded by the --puppetfile and
--moduledir arguments. [0] [1]

This patch replaces all those occurences to future
proof it when the env vars are removed.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/57/529657/2/check/puppet-openstack-integration-4-scenario004-tempest-ubuntu-xenial/ce6f987/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-12-21_22_52_53_499924

Change-Id: I216fe01a13e46c90bbb1455df72b25daf899c9f0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove r10k env vars with proper args

The PUPPETFILE and PUPPETFILE_DIR environment
variables are deprecated since several releases
and are superseeded by the --puppetfile and
--moduledir arguments. [0] [1]

This patch replaces all those occurences to future
proof it when the env vars are removed.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/57/529657/2/check/puppet-openstack-integration-4-scenario004-tempest-ubuntu-xenial/ce6f987/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-12-21_22_52_53_499924
[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/r10k/pull/479

Change-Id: I216fe01a13e46c90bbb1455df72b25daf899c9f0

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/ 2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I93531c668cb64cd5fe0feb9ea3c1a605934aa999
Closes-Bug:#1693670

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 13:23:46.000000000', 'message': 'Configure undercloud containers default params

The noop network config had been removed from the
containerized undercloud deploy script. With the t-h-t
default network configuration, CI wants eth1 and fails
as there is no such interface available for CI slaves.

Parametrize undercloud network config following the
existing overcloud network configuration parameters:
 - (undercloud_)resource_registry_args
 - (undercloud_)network_environment_args.

Set the default net config to net-config-noop.yaml.
Remove network_environment_file as never used for UC.

Closes-bug: #1746540

Change-Id: I8aa0ca5312a162e11c04bce7da4c59980799e8d0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Configure undercloud containers default params

The noop network config had been removed from the
containerized undercloud deploy script. With the t-h-t
default network configuration, CI wants eth1 and fails
as there is no such interface available for CI slaves.

Parametrize undercloud network config following the
existing overcloud network configuration parameters:
 - (undercloud_)resource_registry_args
 - (undercloud_)network_environment_args.

Set the default net config to net-config-noop.yaml.
Remove network_environment_file as never used for UC.

Closes-bug: #1746540

Change-Id: I8aa0ca5312a162e11c04bce7da4c59980799e8d0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
vim_drivers can't be read when service is started

The reason is wrong in manual_installation.rst.
Written in manual_installation.rst is [nfvo], but wrote in the code is
[nfvo_vim].
The source code as follows:
tacker/nfvo/nfvo_plugin.py:79:    cfg.CONF.register_opts(OPTS,
'nfvo_vim')

Change-Id: I6d130e646ca82697f6a2bcc0ef886a16f16912a3

commit_message:
Add support for configuring additional architectures

In this case an additional architecture is any architecture that is NOT
the same as the one running the install.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I23f438cb41ebc454d4a4351901a86452e2b0d482

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id655209306fa0cda1d012dac6996dbfc95dbbc00

with all current multinode jobs to prevent their breakage.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 07:18:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove save configuration implement

The method bind_port will never success in latest ngs because patch
I2d9d47c468b261b826bcd7476065620897d30ffe add save_configuration
implements to ngs. It use send_command(('write',)) method to call netmiko
devices to save, but in fact in will never success because send_command only
accept string parameters and will always raise error like "'tuple' object
has no attribute 'rstrip'". Even if we format the tupple to string, the
command will still not success, because the righ way to save configuration
is like this:
        self.enable()
        self.send_command(command_string='write', expect_string='[Yes')
        self.send_command(command_string='Yes')

So if we want to save configuration successfuly, we need to do a big
change. We don't need to do this because netmiko is working to provide
a save_config method for all swicth connection objects at:
https://github.com/ktbyers/netmiko/pull/686

This best way is to remove save implement in ngs to let bind_port
success now and post a new patch to call save_config after the pull
request above is merged into netmiko. In this way we also don't need to
maintain save commands in ngs.

Change-Id: If108e5e527594b6a1f877d9959cd9b99b0a321c9
Closes-Bug: #1740069
'}, {'created': '2018-02-02 09:03:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove save configuration implement

The method bind_port will never success in latest ngs because patch
I2d9d47c468b261b826bcd7476065620897d30ffe add save_configuration
implements to ngs. It use send_command(('write',)) method to call
netmiko devices to save, but in fact in will never success because
send_command only accept string parameters and will always raise error
like "'tuple' object has no attribute 'rstrip'". Even if we format the
tupple to string, the current design does not work for all switches,
some switches need an extra expect_string in send_command method like
this:
        self.enable()
        self.send_command(command_string='write', expect_string='[Yes')
        self.send_command(command_string='Yes')
If no expect_string given, send_command will stuck until time out.
So if we want to save configuration successfuly, we need to do a big
change. We don't need to do this because netmiko is working to provide
a save_config method for all swicth connection objects at:
https://github.com/ktbyers/netmiko/pull/686

This best way is to remove save implement in ngs to let bind_port
success now and post a new patch to call save_config after the pull
request above is merged into netmiko. In this way we also don't need to
maintain save commands in ngs.

Change-Id: If108e5e527594b6a1f877d9959cd9b99b0a321c9
Closes-Bug: #1740069
'}, {'created': '2018-02-02 09:52:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bind_port error

The method bind_port will never success because send_command in
netmiko only accept string parameters and will always raise error
like "'tuple' object has no attribute 'rstrip'".

This patch fix that.

Change-Id: If108e5e527594b6a1f877d9959cd9b99b0a321c9
Closes-Bug: #1740069
'}, {'created': '2018-02-02 09:54:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bind_port error

'}, {'created': '2018-02-03 03:39:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bind_port error

commit_message:
Fix bind_port error

The method bind_port will never success because send_command in
netmiko only accept string parameters and will always raise error
like "'tuple' object has no attribute 'rstrip'".

This patch fix that.

Change-Id: If108e5e527594b6a1f877d9959cd9b99b0a321c9
Closes-Bug: #1740069

commit_message:
Add policy check for create volume with multiattach

We currently check the policy for multiattach when the new
attach calls are made, but not when the deprecated flag is
passed in. This adds the policy check when only the flag is
set.

Change-Id: Ida001d551b699e6856930ece1b776f52e5c1f7b0

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I9d1ffb79f16f306c83348e4ec5738eebf0f40851

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 23:18:37.000000000', 'message': "Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: Ic0f7a6be9bc3e474a0229b264d1bfe6c8f7e6d85
"}]
commit_message:
Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: Ic0f7a6be9bc3e474a0229b264d1bfe6c8f7e6d85

commit_message:
New configuration being added for Cisco UCSM ML2 driver

Cisco UCSM ML2 driver now accepts the following new configuration
parameters:
1. ucsm_https_verify
2. sp_template_list
3. vnic_template_list

Change-Id: I974c51a4bee4dc2e084cea809b3f93978d09c63b
Closes-Bug: #1742796
(cherry picked from commit b61e1f5e337fcd9fb198ee8568157d28cf1d8bf6)

commit_message:
Add OpenStackCloud object to Connection

Make a cloud attribute on Connection so that people with a Connection
can also use shade features.

This changes the default for shade's list_flavors to NOT fetching
extra_specs, which is very much yay.

Cherry-picked from change I45a5f7f11a9c5ab3c77443a8f5df26089243334c

Change-Id: I3f86d60dec49c048ddba6077033788940e62a2f9

commit_message:
Fix directory absence bug on the elasticsearch

Current elasticsearch chart generate exception inside of docker due to absence
of directory '/var/lib/openstack-helm/elasticsearch' and continuously restarts.
This PS fixes this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1746442
Change-Id: I622f1c7c4e16774b1a3033d66b448e4ab87404b6

subject: Adding coolsvap candidacy for kolla
messages:
[{'account_id': 11105, 'date': '2018-02-05 15:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-05 17:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

None of your contributions since Ocata release day merged to any Kolla team deliverables:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/owner:coolsvap+is:merged+after:2017-02-22

And you're not in the Extra ATCs list for the Kolla team either:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/kolla.html#extra-atcs

So you are not a qualifying candidate for PTL of this team per the OpenStack Technical Committee Charter:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/charter.html"}, {'account_id': 11105, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

The standalone Telemetry role at roles/Telemetry.yaml had an incorrect list of
services. The list has been updated to remove services such as MySQL and
RabbitMQ and the services common to all TripleO roles have been added.

This is not a clean backport from master due to some of the deprecated
Ceilometer services being removed in
Ifd28a3029cd39644833ab0e9fc66efb7b5b67c9d.

Change-Id: I2e3f84ac61eec8dd49cd30ca19b6ebbe25735e27
Closes-Bug: #1745503
(cherry picked from commit 2a25edaf3b78c98ece488e8bc45bdddd340094db)
'}]
commit_message:
Sync services on roles/Telemetry.yaml

The standalone Telemetry role at roles/Telemetry.yaml had an incorrect list of
services. The list has been updated to remove services such as MySQL and
RabbitMQ and the services common to all TripleO roles have been added.

This is not a clean backport from master due to some of the deprecated
Ceilometer services being removed in
Ifd28a3029cd39644833ab0e9fc66efb7b5b67c9d.

Change-Id: I2e3f84ac61eec8dd49cd30ca19b6ebbe25735e27
Closes-Bug: #1745503
(cherry picked from commit 2a25edaf3b78c98ece488e8bc45bdddd340094db)

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2867cf9a5894bb6d2814f12e64b535b9e0dc1334

commit_message:
Restore disable templates for telemetry for Queens

We need these templates accessible for fast forward upgrades
workflow to disable these services. Lets put these back in
and remove them in Rocky instead. These were originally
removed in commit  5ebbc81c2ad90c34925173942bdd4a468964d53b.

Change-Id: Iba1e13c7a78dd012373830331682c9e29d775f73

"}, {'created': '2017-12-14 18:16:19.000000000', 'message': 'Use current-tripleo for images in consistent configs

Images in consistent and promotion-* configs are used for local
run only, because in CI periodic jobs we always build them and
don't download.
For local run it should be safe and always existing path where
user could download image from. Both consistent and
tripleo-ci-testing links are not safe and could not to have images.
Let's use instead "current-tripleo" link, which always include
images. It's always older or equal to "consistent" so it won't
be a problem, because images are always updated in code according
to host repositories (which in our case are kept same - consistent
or tripleo-ci-testing).

Change-Id: I611aa9d23ac5f1369906fb24fd1d1198c163da2b
Closes-Bug: #1738244

commit_message:
Use current-tripleo for images in consistent configs

Images in consistent and promotion-* configs are used for local
run only, because in CI periodic jobs we always build them and
don't download.
For local run it should be safe and always existing path where
user could download image from. Both consistent and
tripleo-ci-testing links are not safe and could not to have images.
Let's use instead "current-tripleo" link, which always include
images. It's always older or equal to "consistent" so it won't
be a problem, because images are always updated in code according
to host repositories (which in our case are kept same - consistent
or tripleo-ci-testing).

Change-Id: I611aa9d23ac5f1369906fb24fd1d1198c163da2b
Closes-Bug: #1738244

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 14:17:36.000000000', 'message': "ovn: Provide the option to configure OVNCMSOptions ('ovn-cms-options') as a role parameter

This option was recently supported in ovn-controller [1]. If this value is configured
in the external_ids column of OpenvSwitch table of OVS database, ovn-controller copies
it to the chassis table, which will be read by Neutron OVN mechanism driver. OVN mech driver can
take certain decisions based on the value. One such use case is setting the value
'enable-chassis-as-gw' in this option. Only those chassis which has this option set,
will be considered as a candidate to schedule a neutron router. So, the administrator
can decide to use only controller nodes (or networker nodes) for scheduling the
router.

[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/4705963f2ce3d0a1fa2184f1456944cf23711284

Change-Id: Iabe5aec30c740447b9714e1b1ace366768488bdb
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ovn: Provide the option to configure OVNCMSOptions ('ovn-cms-options') as a role parameter

This option was recently supported in ovn-controller [1]. If this value is configured
in the external_ids column of OpenvSwitch table of OVS database, ovn-controller copies
it to the chassis table, which will be read by Neutron OVN mechanism driver. OVN mech driver can
take certain decisions based on the value. One such use case is setting the value
'enable-chassis-as-gw' in this option. Only those chassis which has this option set,
will be considered as a candidate to schedule a neutron router. So, the administrator
can decide to use only controller nodes (or networker nodes) for scheduling the
router.

[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/4705963f2ce3d0a1fa2184f1456944cf23711284

Change-Id: Iabe5aec30c740447b9714e1b1ace366768488bdb
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>

Remove unused variable

Instead of items() use the values() or keys() methods if the key
or value is not used.

Change-Id: If95b81ffcde765ca9639fff2dda7054b3da3fd27

Version 2.8.22 of the construct lib has introduced a change that
removed the core.FieldError exception. The check now uses the
parent exception - core.ConstructError.

Change-Id: I31922c2afc2018a4f6f7ba48094388070537a13f
Closes-Bug: 1745208

commit_message:
Remove use of construct lib FieldError exception

Version 2.8.22 of the construct lib has introduced a change that
removed the core.FieldError exception. The check now uses the
parent exception - core.ConstructError.

Change-Id: I31922c2afc2018a4f6f7ba48094388070537a13f
Closes-Bug: 1745208
(cherry picked from commit a6f2805bbc2d51918a027ca519ada793cb6c9cf9)

Use the -x option with git cherry-pick to add the "cherry-picked from commit xxx" line, like in the stable/pike backport:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-04 22:15:07.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): As with the stable/ocata version of
Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 these conflicts are caused by
_create_domain_and_network using an additional disk_info argument in O.

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
(cherry picked from commit 236bb54493385bcfe2034e8b0fd7a387fa66635a)
(cherry picked from commit 83ffc76edd360929925fc4bb66e5dcbf8254a30e)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): As with the stable/ocata version of
Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 these conflicts are caused by
_create_domain_and_network using an additional disk_info argument in O.

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
(cherry picked from commit 236bb54493385bcfe2034e8b0fd7a387fa66635a)
(cherry picked from commit 83ffc76edd360929925fc4bb66e5dcbf8254a30e)

commit_message:
Add event_time_to_live for panko config

By default panko keeps data for ever, exposing this will
help user tweak this setting and expire data periodically.

commit_message:
Make the validations workflow a bit more robust

The validations workflows would fail in strange ways in certain
conditions. This refactors the workflows a bit and makes the result
checking more robust by using the get() yaql function.

Change-Id: I6e37df8989cab507c4f404094d127db1bac51c1b
Closes-Bug: #1723170

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 01:08:57.000000000', 'message': "Query all cells for service version in _validate_bdm

We call _validate_bdm during instance creation to validate block device
mappings boot indexes, accessibility, attachability, and so on. We need
to query the service version in order to decide which Cinder APIs to
call and because we're in the middle of creating the instance, we
don't yet know which cell it's going to land in.

This changes the service version query to check all cells so that
_validate_bdm will use the 'reserve_volume' Cinder API in a multi-cell
environment. Use of the 'reserve_volume' API is based on the service
version check and without targeting any cells, the service version will
be 0 and we'll use the old 'check_attach' API.

Closes-Bug: #1746634

Change-Id: I68d5398d2a6d85c833e46ce682672008dbd5c4c1
"}]
commit_message:
Query all cells for service version in _validate_bdm

We call _validate_bdm during instance creation to validate block device
mappings boot indexes, accessibility, attachability, and so on. We need
to query the service version in order to decide which Cinder APIs to
call and because we're in the middle of creating the instance, we
don't yet know which cell it's going to land in.

This changes the service version query to check all cells so that
_validate_bdm will use the 'reserve_volume' Cinder API in a multi-cell
environment. Use of the 'reserve_volume' API is based on the service
version check and without targeting any cells, the service version will
be 0 and we'll use the old 'check_attach' API.

Closes-Bug: #1746634

Change-Id: I68d5398d2a6d85c833e46ce682672008dbd5c4c1

commit_message:
Optimize SELinux bits in os_nova

Installing openstack-selinux brings in a *ton* of policies and the
vast majority do not apply to an OpenStack-Ansible deployment. We
can bring in the individual policies that we need in each role.

The openstack-selinux package takes 2-3 minutes to install and it
brings in container-selinux (which is mainly for Docker) and that
adds another 30-45 seconds.

The patch also adds some required SELinux policies for virtlogd to
work and for the non-KVM qemu gate jobs to function properly.

Closes-Bug: 1746602
Change-Id: Ib79cd5f8ebd9cb535c8051a29126262ede2b17d3

commit_message:
Create rescue user on ironic agent

Create a new service, that will be launched after ironic
agent has been exited. This will launch an script that will
take the rescue password, and create the rescue user with
that credentials.

Depends-On: I7898ff22800dedba73d7fbfb3801378867abe183
Change-Id: Ic3a241e2789a122d3d966e7e2148306fd0cf6aed
Partial-Bug: 1526449

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: If07b491141f68b5b23f93d671d01cfcdeb0bd2ba

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 5756, 'name': 'Terry Wilson', 'email': 'twilson@redhat.com', 'username': 'otherwiseguy'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-01-31 10:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-31 12:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This will need to wait until the freeze is over.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-01-31 13:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:50:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Do you have a FFE for the constraint update to ensure this version is used?

Do we need to do this now, or can it wait until after the final release date when we start with stable releases?'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-02-02 17:15:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This whole situation is a little odd since it seems impossible to make a release against master (we already have stable/queens but no deliverables/rocky), but technically possible to do one with stable releases.

I haven't gotten an FFE (didn't even think about it since this isn't a feature, but a bug fix that keeps transactions from failing after a DB reconnect--something that seems to happen fairly often in CI, causing test failures).

I've been assuming we can't really fix the gate issues until the release is made and that can't happen until there is a deliverables/rocky in releases? If that isn't the case, let me know what I should do and I'll do it."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-02 19:13:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> This whole situation is a little odd since it seems impossible to
 > make a release against master (we already have stable/queens but no
 > deliverables/rocky), but technically possible to do one with stable
 > releases.
 > 
 > I haven't gotten an FFE (didn't even think about it since this
 > isn't a feature, but a bug fix that keeps transactions from failing
 > after a DB reconnect--something that seems to happen fairly often
 > in CI, causing test failures).
 > 
 > I've been assuming we can't really fix the gate issues until the
 > release is made and that can't happen until there is a
 > deliverables/rocky in releases? If that isn't the case, let me know
 > what I should do and I'll do it.

We won't be releasing anything as part of rocky until after the final release of queens at the end of the month, but that shouldn't block you from doing what you need here.

You can release your fixes from the stable/queens branch and update the constraints list in openstack/releases on master so that it is used in the test jobs. We haven't branched the requirements repo, yet, so if you update the constraints list before the branch is created next week you won't have to worry about backporting that change, too.

The FFE would be for prior approval from the requirements team to update the constraint file. If you have a gate-blocking bug, then it should be easy enough to make the case. You need to start a thread on the mailing list with [release][requirements][FFE] in the subject line explaining what is needed. Please post the link to that thread here."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-03 14:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

FFE for the requirements change approved:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-February/126935.html

We can release this on Monday.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-03 14:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Does still need PTL or release liaison ack.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-02-03 22:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-03 23:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-05 22:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Import user-data page from openstack-manuals

This imports the "provide-user-data-to-instances" page
from the old openstack-manuals user guide.

Since we don't have a glossary, the :term: link is removed
and replaced with just giving the glossary definition as
the first part of the doc.

Change-Id: Iae70d9b53d6cefb3bcb107fe68499cccb71fc15e
Partial-Bug: #1714017
(cherry picked from commit 3fc85389e5e500e25cebf4d89094e7d06bf63605)

commit_message:
Refactor self.*_api out of tests

Just like the APIs in keystone, we should be using the
`keystone.common.provider_api.ProviderAPIs` to load managers instead
of self.

This makes those changes for a few of the test modules. Finding
occurrences can be done with `grep -R 'self.*_api' keystone/tests/`.

Change-Id: Ic2094dca56158d8e4cd843eadff837f3a17ea38f

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for auth APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I44b21fe636926925c50b2116c85f20a6e7a11d00

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 14:05:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error in router port maintenance code

When a port needs to be created or updated on OVN side by the
maintenance task we need to recover the router ID from the
port, which is on the device_id field.
At some point in time during development it got changed to
device_owner, which is a logical name referring to the type
of owner: compute, router, dhcp, etc...)

Such mistake was causing the maintenance code uncapable of
recovering router ports that were detected as outdated, or
not created on the OVN side.

Change-Id: Iea8060b11cc4076e6efc300dd9079ddafcc3fb5e
Closes-Bug: 1746979
'}, {'created': '2018-02-02 14:47:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error in router port maintenance code

When a port needs to be created or updated on OVN side by the
maintenance task we need to recover the router ID from the
port, which is on the device_id field.
At some point in time during development it got changed to
device_owner, which is a logical name referring to the type
of owner: compute, router, dhcp, etc...)

Also, when getting the lrouter port from the NBDB we were
using a uuid, while we needed to convert uuid to lrp port
name.

Those mistakes was causing the maintenance code uncapable of
recovering router ports that were detected as outdated, or
not created on the OVN side.

commit_message:
Fix error in router port maintenance code

When a port needs to be created or updated on OVN side by the
maintenance task we need to recover the router ID from the
port, which is on the device_id field.
At some point in time during development it got changed to
device_owner, which is a logical name referring to the type
of owner: compute, router, dhcp, etc...)

Also, when getting the lrouter port from the NBDB we were
using a uuid, while we needed to convert uuid to lrp port
name.

Those mistakes was causing the maintenance code uncapable of
recovering router ports that were detected as outdated, or
not created on the OVN side.

Change-Id: Iea8060b11cc4076e6efc300dd9079ddafcc3fb5e
Closes-Bug: 1746979

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 22:40:18.000000000', 'message': 'upgrade pip before using -c option

commit_message:
upgrade pip before using -c option

The installed pip can be an older version which does not support
the -c argument. Therefore, upgrade pip before using -c.

Change-Id: If18d8ea822a62c8551c9c4d47354d58b0299fed2
Closes-Bug: 1744403

commit_message:
Add the nova-multiattach job to the check/gate queues

The nova-multiattach job is defined in the nova repo
but we also need to run it against Tempest changes.

For now the job just runs the tempest compute API tests
since that's the only place in Tempest that has multiattach
testing right now and it will save some time in the CI run.

Change-Id: Idfb68b5ddd7aca8642016e392fec6efd169c1ea2
Depends-On: I51adbbdf13711e463b4d25c2ffd4a3123cd65675

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2226881d18e69bf25ad93ee8b8db67248e14f697

commit_message:
Expose a bug that application credential cache is not invalidated

Application credential cache is not invalidated when
the related user is disabled/deleted or the related
assignment is removed.

This patch expose the bug and will fix it in the
following patch.

Change-Id: I8a43a6a57f049bc9501beca6f30057073ad41b12
Partial-Bug: #1747332

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 07:07:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix inconsistency of account info in expirer's unit tests

In expirer's unit tests, FakeInternalClient instances simulates
expirer's task queue behavior. But get_account_info method of
the FakeInternalClient returns container count = 1 and object
count = 2, even if it simulate different count of containers or
objects.

This patch fixes the behavior. The return values of get_account_info
will be equal to simulated container and object counts.

This patch will make review for expirer's task queue upgrade patch [1]
more easy.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Change-Id: Id5339ea7e10e4577ff22daeb91ec90f08704c98d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistency of account info in expirer's unit tests

In expirer's unit tests, FakeInternalClient instances simulates
expirer's task queue behavior. But get_account_info method of
the FakeInternalClient returns container count = 1 and object
count = 2, even if it simulate different count of containers or
objects.

This patch fixes the behavior. The return values of get_account_info
will be equal to simulated container and object counts.

This patch will make review for expirer's task queue upgrade patch [1]
more easy.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517389

Change-Id: Id5339ea7e10e4577ff22daeb91ec90f08704c98d

[{'created': '2018-02-03 00:02:10.000000000', 'message': "Doc: Nix os-traits link from POST resource_classes

The placement API reference documentation for POST /resource_classes [1]
said:

The new class must be a custom resource class, prefixed with CUSTOM_ and
distinct from the _standard_ resource classes.

...where _standard_ was a link to os-traits documentation [2]. Since we
don't have os-resource-classes (yet), this change set removes that
linkitude.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#create-resource-class
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/os-traits/latest/

Change-Id: I15fbed460598b7d603eca48cbaecf1036906f6c7
Closes-Bug: #1747095
"}]
commit_message:
Doc: Nix os-traits link from POST resource_classes

The placement API reference documentation for POST /resource_classes [1]
said:

The new class must be a custom resource class, prefixed with CUSTOM_ and
distinct from the _standard_ resource classes.

...where _standard_ was a link to os-traits documentation [2]. Since we
don't have os-resource-classes (yet), this change set removes that
linkitude.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#create-resource-class
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/os-traits/latest/

Change-Id: I15fbed460598b7d603eca48cbaecf1036906f6c7
Closes-Bug: #1747095

commit_message:
Use 'with' method rather than having to call close

gzip.GzipFile() supports 'with' statement usage. Use that rather than
having to call close() explicitly. Plus with a 'with' statement if
there is an exception it will still call close()

Change-Id: I8535dffd66ffd7244b8bdcc4d79d6cf437a4d779

subject: Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()
messages:
[{'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-02 00:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-02 05:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13689, 'date': '2018-02-02 09:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-02 12:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-05 19:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 00:35:00.000000000', 'message': "Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: I6be901f8e01e0ff1b1e2b8c5197b320b5f8026fb
"}]
commit_message:
Replace use of functools.wraps() with six.wraps()

In Python 2.7, functools.wraps() does not provide the '__wrapped__'
attribute. This attribute is used by
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() when getting the signature of a
function. If a function is decorated without the '__wrapped__'
attribute then the signature will be of the decorator rather than the
underlying function.

From the six documentation for six.wraps():
    This is exactly the functools.wraps() decorator, but it sets the
    __wrapped__ attribute on what it decorates as functools.wraps()
    does on Python versions after 3.2.

Change-Id: I6be901f8e01e0ff1b1e2b8c5197b320b5f8026fb

messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-04 15:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-02-04 19:48:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

+2 for a UC bump in requirements, gr bump should be discussed between reqs and releases (since it'll hit releases hardest)."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-04 22:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

We can discuss more, but based on the problems found, I think raising the g-r is probably the best route here. We can release affected clients yet. We will just need to be careful that they have not already backported other changes into the stable/queens branch in preparation for a post-freeze stable release.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-05 21:16:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-04 15:29:02.000000000', 'message': "Release 0.11.3 of openstacksdk for queens

The osc-functional-devstack-tips job, which tests master changes of
openstackclient and openstacksdk against each other with
openstackclient's functional tests was broken and was not testing
master against master but rather master of openstackclient against
released version of SDK. Therefore, the gate that was protecting us
against these breakages was incorrect.

The gate job has been fixed and SDK as of this commit fixes the
osc-functional-devstack-tips job. The osc-functional-devstack job, which
checks OSC against released SDK is broken with 0.11.2 because of the
bug fixed in this patch.

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540554/ in OSC shows the -tips
jobs working. It depends on the master version of this fix. It also
shows the non-tips job broken, which is due to the issue here. When we
cut this release and bump the constraint, OSC's devstack job should go
green.

Change-Id: I1ff62751a3b62d050e1459c04931cb4d98681a48
"}]
commit_message:
Release 0.11.3 of openstacksdk for queens

The osc-functional-devstack-tips job, which tests master changes of
openstackclient and openstacksdk against each other with
openstackclient's functional tests was broken and was not testing
master against master but rather master of openstackclient against
released version of SDK. Therefore, the gate that was protecting us
against these breakages was incorrect.

The gate job has been fixed and SDK as of this commit fixes the
osc-functional-devstack-tips job. The osc-functional-devstack job, which
checks OSC against released SDK is broken with 0.11.2 because of the
bug fixed in this patch.

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540554/ in OSC shows the -tips
jobs working. It depends on the master version of this fix. It also
shows the non-tips job broken, which is due to the issue here. When we
cut this release and bump the constraint, OSC's devstack job should go
green.

Change-Id: I1ff62751a3b62d050e1459c04931cb4d98681a48

Matt gave approval for the constraint update in IRC.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-05 14:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-05 14:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-05 14:25:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

looks like we had a release failure with another project, let's check that before making things worse"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-05 21:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

subject: Add Steve McLellan's candidacy for Searchlight
messages:
[{'account_id': 10063, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:16:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I can't find any OpenStack Foundation Individual Membership matching your E-mail address from Gerrit. Please make sure you have a current foundation membership and that it has at least one associated E-mail address matching at least one E-mail address on file for your Gerrit account.

You can join the OpenStack Foundation for free at https://www.openstack.org/join and you can double-check your Gerrit E-mail addresses at https://review.openstack.org/#/settings/contact when logged in."}, {'account_id': 10063, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@jeremy Not sure what to say... I've been using this address for the last 4 years. It's the only one on the contact page."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-02 23:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The problem's not with your Gerrit account but lack of OpenStack Foundation Individual Membership. Please see the announcement I sent last cycle for details: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-July/119786.html

It's possible your membership expired due to failure to vote in two consecutive OpenStack Foundation Board of Directors elections, or that you simply never applied for a OpenStack Foundation Individual Membership, or that I'm failing to find your membership for other reasons. If you are an OpenStack Foundation Individual Member then a link to your individual member profile would help me figure out where the lookup is failing. For example, my individual member profile is https://www.openstack.org/community/members/profile/5479/jeremy-stanley ."}, {'account_id': 10063, 'date': '2018-02-05 14:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My apologies - I do recall reading that now but (erroneously) didn't think it applied since i was still active. I've updated myself to foundation member."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for updating your foundation membership. Your candidacy has been rechecked and is now valid for this team.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-02-05 21:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Node state configuration - add log_agent_heartbeat

We import the option already, by default it is False.
When the node state configuration sent to neutron via
rpc contains 'log_agent_heartbeat: True' neutron will
log "Heartbeat recieved ..." messages in it's logs.

Change-Id: I6039aa0e271531bfeb9e6606be25776899c50349

commit_message:
Replace legacy tempest-dsvm-py35

We now have a tempest-full-py3 zuulv3 native job. Drop the legacy
job in the integrated-gate-py35 and replace with the new native
job. The native job only works on master, and it will work on
stable/queens once the branch is created, but that's ok since
the legacy job only works starting on queens as well.

The branch filters out all stable branches. Updating the brach
logic to exclude all stable branches before stable/queens.

The legacy job is not used anywhere else, so removing it.
The template now uses only new style jobs, so moving it out of
zuul-legacy into project-templates.yaml.

Depends-on: I4a8fa1759665038788e1b86fd3a5030fd6c68573

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Idb05c3c21b14da5d5bdcb662ed1e43b641fa6fa0

[{'created': '2018-01-27 23:11:11.000000000', 'message': 'Re-enable "Page Contents" and update user docs

This patch re-enables the page Table of Contents (ToC) for the Octavia
documentation. Previously the theme had the table of contents at the top
of each page which cluttered our index pages. Now the theme based ToC is
located on the left navigation menu.

This patch also reorganizes the user documentation section and adds a link
to our "Introduction to OpenStack Load Balancing" presentation from the
2017 Boston summit.

This change will not impact bookmarks.

Change-Id: Ib200f8b95e216b081d884da017fa1cce85f48763
'}, {'created': '2018-02-05 18:05:06.000000000', 'message': 'Re-enable "Page Contents" and update user docs

documentation. Previously the theme had the table of contents at the top
of each page which cluttered our index pages. Now the theme based ToC is
located on the left navigation menu.

This patch also reorganizes the user documentation section and adds a link

This change will not impact bookmarks.

Change-Id: Ib200f8b95e216b081d884da017fa1cce85f48763
'}]
commit_message:
Re-enable "Page Contents" and update user docs

This patch re-enables the page Table of Contents (ToC) for the Octavia
documentation. Previously the theme had the table of contents at the top
of each page which cluttered our index pages. Now the theme based ToC is
located on the left navigation menu.

This patch also reorganizes the user documentation section and adds a link
to our "Introduction to OpenStack Load Balancing" presentation from the
2017 Boston summit.

This change will not impact bookmarks.

Change-Id: Ib200f8b95e216b081d884da017fa1cce85f48763

Deprecate Classic Drivers

Switches bifrost to use hardware types
and deprecates the use of classic drivers.

commit_message:
Separate common ovb settings

This review creates a common ovb settings file
so that featureset files and similar feature-specific
files only contain the specific settings defined for
that run and not the environment.

Closes-Bug: #1747055
Change-Id: I6a735bd3f9ad03380909ac015c6ca5edf243cec6

[{'created': '2018-01-24 22:12:31.000000000', 'message': 'Format group:ansible deployments

The group:ansible deployments were not formatted as human readable in
the group_vars. It was all just one long line. This made manual review

commit_message:
Format group:ansible deployments

The group:ansible deployments were not formatted as human readable in
the group_vars. It was all just one long line. This made manual review
and debugging more difficult. It should instead be in a human readable
format.

To accomplish that, we first attempt to convert the config value to
JSON, then pretty print it.

Change-Id: I1916d0378d4687966ec7b01f022e70c10e813f3c
Closes-Bug: #1745241

commit_message:
Specify SSH server list when configuring octavia

Uses the controller IP list to set the ssh_servers parameter for
enabling the ssh admin user. This is now required because of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533599/

Change-Id: Ib56399ee767f58dd841cd385ec265722439b1653

commit_message:
Use telemetry-tempest-plugin for Telemetry projects

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532773/ moves gnocchi tests
  under telemetry-tempest-plugin. It is better to use and update
  the name space.

* Added python-heat-tests-tempest for heat support in
  telemetry-tempest-plugin
  
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540711

Change-Id: I932721000f1954b5b1eceda9964f9313de386413

commit_message:
Add CephClient and CephExternal to the Telemetry role

Previously the deployment of the Telemetry role with Ceph would
fail as the Ceph clients didn't get configured on the Telemetry
nodes.

Closes-Bug: 1746525
Change-Id: I0644d028c269afce4c561bbf5b8ca1f2c4addda2

commit_message:
bgpvpn: support for port association 'bgpvpn' routes

BGPVPN OVObjects: add support for the 'bgpvpn' type of Port Association
routes.

BGPVPN agent extension: translate the information from this type into
route readvertisement configuration in bagpipe-bgp

Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control
Depends-On: Ic4b5bc16d1326a328176f121b3b5c3e93d707fd5
Change-Id: I57c178ec0b148e64f65feb66e19a889f7d9953d2

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ibe22f33b6dcea1cf4a205404ce55d1a9ec851bb1

commit_message:
Use zuul-sudo-grep

Remove jenkins-sudo-grep and use zuul-sudo-grep instead in the only user
which is run-tox.sh.

This allows to cleanup the legacy pre.yaml file in openstack-zuul-jobs.
that file replaces already jenkins-sudo-grep with zuul-sudo-grep.

Remove also now unneeded jenkins-sudo-grep settings.

Change-Id: I73e57eef72b1e5a0ec7be9e57160b24c6076e710
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/538344

commit_message:

I think its because of the setting for the SUBNET in undercloud.py.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-15 20:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-15 20:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck 

ovb IPMI timeout error.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-18 16:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck ovb'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-18 22:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Ok, so I think I found the issue.

Undercloud prior this patch results in the following flows on ovs:

[stack@master-undercloud ~]$ sudo ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-ctlplane
 cookie=0x8558d70033702f44, duration=207.106s, table=0, n_packets=3, n_bytes=270, priority=4,in_port="phy-br-ctlplane",dl_vlan=1 actions=strip_vlan,NORMAL
 cookie=0x8558d70033702f44, duration=700.040s, table=0, n_packets=2, n_bytes=168, priority=2,in_port="phy-br-ctlplane" actions=drop
 cookie=0x8558d70033702f44, duration=700.063s, table=0, n_packets=1587, n_bytes=90274, priority=0 actions=NORMAL

[stack@master-undercloud ~]$ sudo ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int
 cookie=0x13bcc2091ea9acf7, duration=210.615s, table=0, n_packets=477, n_bytes=27262, priority=3,in_port="int-br-ctlplane",vlan_tci=0x0000/0x1fff actions=mod_vlan_vid:1,resubmit(,60)
 cookie=0x13bcc2091ea9acf7, duration=703.555s, table=0, n_packets=1118, n_bytes=63444, priority=2,in_port="int-br-ctlplane" actions=drop
 cookie=0x13bcc2091ea9acf7, duration=703.759s, table=0, n_packets=5, n_bytes=438, priority=0 actions=resubmit(,60)
 cookie=0x13bcc2091ea9acf7, duration=703.761s, table=23, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=0 actions=drop
 cookie=0x13bcc2091ea9acf7, duration=703.753s, table=24, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=0 actions=drop
 cookie=0x13bcc2091ea9acf7, duration=703.757s, table=60, n_packets=482, n_bytes=27700, priority=3 actions=NORMAL


After applying this patch the rulst is different.

[root@leafs ~]# ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int
 cookie=0xa12001ecbfb0dfdd, duration=87.776s, table=0, n_packets=178, n_bytes=9708, priority=2,in_port="int-br-ctlplane" actions=drop
 cookie=0xa12001ecbfb0dfdd, duration=88.175s, table=0, n_packets=11, n_bytes=690, priority=0 actions=resubmit(,60)
 cookie=0xa12001ecbfb0dfdd, duration=88.177s, table=23, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=0 actions=drop
 cookie=0xa12001ecbfb0dfdd, duration=88.172s, table=24, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=0 actions=drop
 cookie=0xa12001ecbfb0dfdd, duration=88.173s, table=60, n_packets=11, n_bytes=690, priority=3 actions=NORMAL

[root@leafs ~]# ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-ctlplane
 cookie=0x7b0a49188b2ddb95, duration=92.752s, table=0, n_packets=11, n_bytes=690, priority=2,in_port="phy-br-ctlplane" actions=drop
 cookie=0x7b0a49188b2ddb95, duration=92.803s, table=0, n_packets=189, n_bytes=10302, priority=0 actions=NORMAL



Without those flows in place there is no data going trough the patch between br-int and br-ctlplane, e.g the PXE boot DHCP traffic never gets to the dhcp namespace.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-19 01:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-19 11:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-01-19 15:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-01-31 22:18:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-02-01 23:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-05 14:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Small nit but otherwise lgtm'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-02-05 15:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Small nit but otherwise lgtm

Thanks Steven.'}]

commit_message:
Move ctlplane network/subnet setup to python

For routed networks deployment we need to create multiple
subnets on the controlplane network. The logic to implement
this is more involved and so doing this in python makes sense.

This change moves the current network config from
98-undercloud-setup to a python implementation.

Change-Id: I0168991a0fbd9dacf708ba2bdbc13248414affbe
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

commit_message:
Use non-legacy job results in neutron-dynamic-routing grafana

There seems to be no non-legacy job data for periodic-py35-with-neutron-lib-master.
So grafana displays legacy job results for it.

Change-Id: I436db3313742beaf862c35ab049257dc0f27c8f6

commit_message:
Don't enable heat api_cloudwatch

Heat has removed the cloudwatch api in [1] and
it's package is removed in RDO in [2] so remove
it's usage from puppet-openstack-integration as well.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534660/
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11705/

Change-Id: I2a69301c98366a49d3a5eb4184b9c20d9708551e

commit_message:
eventlet workaround to avoid import cycle issue

Do get_hub() before monkey_patch() to workaround issue with
import cycles in eventlet < 0.22.0;
Based on the worked-around in eventlet with patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Also reverts the test skipping that was done because of the issue.

Revert "temporarily skip local haht test under py27"
This reverts commit de2e4f1cfc6780e81c6e4a08af4839cdc3e624bc.

Closes-Bug: 1746136
Closes-Bug: 1745112

Change-Id: I72c349e81dfc02136b22637c707ad4908c9f269e

commit_message:
Use six.wraps() for Metrics so decorated methods can be inspected

Previously it was using functools.wraps() to create the decorators.
The problem is that we can't use the
oslo_utils.reflection.get_signature() function to get the correct
signature.

Change it to use six.wraps() which will add the '__wrapped__'
attribute which will be used when calling get_signature() and return
the signature of the decorated function.

Added unit tests to show we are able to see the signature of a wrapped
function.

Closes-Bug: #1746730
Change-Id: I75428e948b64b3b6758d31678a80d158a11c6beb

commit_message:
Don't lock for vif_attach unless active

In review of a similar change to vif_detch, it was
pointed out that we should consider the same basic
change to attach logic, as in our workflow there is
really not a compelling reason to block unless the
node is active.

Related-Bug #1743652

Change-Id: I16c573d5981d14f98379b6082828a6099724d686

commit_message:
Add memcached servers wiring

By default, we could make sure keystone is used with memcached.
For that we wire the new directive keystone_cache_servers to
the memcached hosts from the group that's defined in
test_memcached_group.

If the role has no memcached_all group, it would use the
all_containers group, while if it has it, it would use it
directly. That allows testing multiple scenarios if need be.

Change-Id: I1be8ad46c29c1719c7fadd4c91aeea21923d5681
Depends-On: I85ebce8b41dd440e1866a08aa1329b3df798c04f

commit_message:
Set server status to ERROR if rebuild failed

Currently there is no indication that the rebuild was refused,
and worse, we may have a wrong imageref for the instance.

This patch set the instance to ERROR status if rebuild failed in the
scheduling stage. The user can rebuild the instance with valid image
to get it out of ERROR state and reset with right instance metadata and
properties.

Closes-Bug: 1744325

 Conflicts:
    nova/conductor/manager.py
    nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1713783.py
    nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py
    nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts were because of log translation, the fact
that the regression test for bug 1713783 doesn't exist in Ocata, there
are addtional rebuild functional tests in Pike that don't exist in
Ocata, and the select_destinations method has additional parameters in
Pike that don't exist in Ocata.

Change-Id: Ibb7bee15a3d4ee6f0ef53ba12e8b41f65a1fe999
(cherry picked from commit d03a890a34f632adc9a19a33c8a5aebbccec50e4)
(cherry picked from commit 22a39b8f9b76d5f330a3f185e7d40f208a6a47f3)

nova in the pike release we missed the config-drive docs.

This change does the following:

1. Imports the config-drive doc into the user guide.
2. Fixes a broken link to the metadata service in the doc.
3. Removes a note about liberty being the current release.
4. Adds a link in the API reference parameters to actually
   point at the document we have in tree now, which is
   otherwise not very discoverable as the main index does
   not link to this page (or the user index for that matter).

commit_message:
Import the config drive docs from openstack-manuals

As part of the docs migration from openstack-manuals to
nova in the pike release we missed the config-drive docs.

This change does the following:

1. Imports the config-drive doc into the user guide.
2. Fixes a broken link to the metadata service in the doc.
3. Removes a note about liberty being the current release.
4. Adds a link in the API reference parameters to actually
   point at the document we have in tree now, which is
   otherwise not very discoverable as the main index does
   not link to this page (or the user index for that matter).

Partial-Bug: #1714017
Closes-Bug: #1720873

Change-Id: I1d54e1f5a1a94e9821efad99b7fa430bd8fece0a
(cherry picked from commit 59bd2f6adc1777c7c8d7a2f442be965fecb573a0)

commit_message:
WIP: Tempest tests for cascade delete

Not quite working yet, since I haven't figured out how
to coerce the client into hitting the v3 API for cascade
delete.

Change-Id: Ibab62195c595995845631de84e11846d1776fdcf

I attempted to address this here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281550/  I need to update the patch, but the issues raised there are also present in this patch.  The bug created for this patch as a placeholder is probably not necessary, and the orignial bug reference is missing.

It would be nice if interest in improving this driver was then followed by an attempt to communicate with other interested developers. I think a fair amount of duplicated effort and confusion could be spared with an email or two (or IRC if you prefer).'}, {'account_id': 18967, 'date': '2017-02-14 01:48:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi, Jon, thanks for you advice, I will attempt to discuss in mail-list in the futher.

But I think this patch give a better way to solve the problem for the following reasons:

1.Placeholder needs one more temp snapshot, it wastes more rsources and brings more complexity.

2.The palceholder does't really solve the problem,  Consider such a dependency chain:  ... volume4 -> snap4 -> volume5 -> snap5 -> volume6 ,if we create a palceholder 'snap5.deleted' when delete the snap5, the volume5 and any other volumes/snaps which created earlier in the chain still can't be deleted."}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2017-02-14 02:26:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Build failed. To recheck use 'lenovo-ci: recheck'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/Lenovo_Storage_CI

- lenovo-fc http://os-logs.tristero.net/26/432326/4/check/lenovo-fc/25f4f4d : FAILURE in 3s
- lenovo-iscsi http://os-logs.tristero.net/26/432326/4/check/lenovo-iscsi/4eec9c8 : FAILURE in 1h 46m 40s"}, {'account_id': 18967, 'date': '2017-02-23 16:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi, could anyone help to review? This is really a important problem if we use rbd in product environment. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2017-02-23 17:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@zhangrong, in your above case volume4 -> snap4 -> volume5 -> snap5 -> volume6, you also can't delete volume5 after updating snap5 to snap5.deleted. As ceph tells "image has snapshots". Also in cinder, it fails to delete volume5 as it has dependent snaps.'}, {'account_id': 18967, 'date': '2017-02-23 17:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi, LisaLi. Thanks for you advice, but this is not the problem. For your question 'As ceph tells "image has snapshots".', when user deletes volume5, we can also mark volume5 as '.deleted' and delete it till snap5 is really deleted, and we can walk back the parent chain to delete all the voluemes/snapshots. This logic has been already completed in deleting a cloned volume, you can reference the relevant code. The other question 'Also in cinder, it fails to delete volume5 as it has dependent snaps.', Although snap5 is not really deleted in rbd backend, it is really deleted in cinder database, so the question is not exist.

You can test the case with this patch, it can really solve the problem. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2017-02-23 18:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Set volume5 to volume5.deleted can fix the problem. In my opinion, the differences between this change and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281550/ is that you set image to image.deleted, and in patch 281550 it creates a new image with image.deleted. So if in 281550, it creates volume5.deleted it also can solve above problem. 

I am afraid that this will cause a mess in ceph cluster. Another option is that we flatten the COW image, unprotect and delete the snapshot when we want to delete its parent snapshot. This makes consistent between cinder and ceph cluster. The disadvantage is that it causes data move.'}, {'account_id': 18967, 'date': '2017-02-23 21:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yes, creating volume.deleted will cause a mess in ceph cluster. The costs is too great so that it is difficult to use it in product environment.


To the ceph branch earlier than Harmer, I think we can try to rename it first, and raise a imageisbusy exception as before when it failed. This can not only keep compatible to the earlier ceph branch, but also solve the problem well in the new branch. Do you think so? Hope for your advice.'}, {'account_id': 18967, 'date': '2017-02-23 21:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2017-02-23 22:02:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-10 14:34:02.000000000', 'message': "RBD:Make referenced snapshot deletable

A referenced snapshot which has children can't be deleted in
current rbd driver. For example:

1.Create a volume named volume1;
2.Take a snapshot(snap1) for it;
3.create a new volume(volume2) from snap1;

Now, snap1 is referenced by volume2, it can't be deleted until
volume2 is deleted; and we also can't delete volume1 because
it has a snapshot(snap1). This means volumes and snapshots in this
chain all can't be deleted if user don't remove the tail one.

It lead to poor user experence and is a waste of storage resource.
This patch provides a method to delete a referenced snapshot/volume.

Change-Id: I472905da8e744d12496be8e8eaff0b6e8d0b1c5f
"}, {'created': '2017-02-11 06:17:59.000000000', 'message': "RBD:Make referenced snapshot deletable

A referenced snapshot which has children can't be deleted in
current rbd driver. Consider such a dependency chain:

... volume4 -> snap4 -> volume5 -> snap5 -> volume6

The snap5 is referenced by volume6, it can't be deleted until
volume6 is deleted; and we also can't delete volume5 because
it is depend by snap5, and so on... This means volumes and
snapshots in this chain all can't be deleted if user don't
remove the tail one.

It lead to poor user experence and is a waste of storage resource.
In this patch, we provide a method to fix the problem: If a
snapshot has copy-on-write child we keep it as a silent snapshot
by marking it as '.deleted' in rbd backend and will delete it when
it's children are deleted.

Change-Id: I472905da8e744d12496be8e8eaff0b6e8d0b1c5f
Closes-Bug: #1663814

commit_message:
RBD:Make referenced snapshot deletable

A referenced snapshot which has children can't be deleted in
current rbd driver. Consider such a dependency chain:

... volume4 -> snap4 -> volume5 -> snap5 -> volume6

The snap5 is referenced by volume6, it can't be deleted until
volume6 is deleted; and we also can't delete volume5 because
it is needed by snap5, and so on... This means volumes and
snapshots in this chain all can't be deleted if user doesn't
remove the tail one.

It leads to poor user experence and is a waste of storage resource.
In this patch, we provide a method to fix the problem: If a
snapshot has copy-on-write child we keep it as a silent snapshot
by marking it as '.deleted' in rbd backend and will delete it when
it's children are deleted.

Change-Id: I472905da8e744d12496be8e8eaff0b6e8d0b1c5f
Closes-Bug: #1663814

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC and PS volume backup not supported

The Dell SC and PS Cinder drivers do not currently support backup.

A Known Anomolies section has been added to the driver docs
calling out this current limitation.

Change-Id: I5a0ed53bfbfe5fdc648ef862ed2e710bf3e175fd
