commit_message:
Cinder Driver for FusionStack's FusionStor block storage

FusionStor is a software-defined storage product.
Through Ethernet or InfiniBand with high speed and
low latency, it integrates different types of hard
drives into a block storage resource.
FusionStor has no metadata server, using an operating
system (OS)-bypass architect together with DPDK, RDMA,
and SPDK techniques. FusionStor archives more than
10 million IOPS on one node, with an average
latency of less than 500 microseconds.

Implements: blueprint driver-for-fusionstor

Change-Id: I5ac10e3afe43814ab67eb28412a9724dca059cf3

[{'created': '2017-03-10 01:35:57.000000000', 'message': "RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value.

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth

commit_message:
RBD driver doesn't flatten image when clone depth > configured value

RBD driver has a rbd_max_clone_depth config option which would trigger
image flatten operation when a RBD image has been chain-cloned to that
value.  But the driver only trigger flatten when actual clone depth
equals rbd_max_clone_depth.  There are cases where actual clone depth
is bigger than rbd_max_clone_depth (for example: admin somehow changed
rbd_max_clone_depth from a bigger value to a smaller value),
auto-flatten won't be triggered.  This change allows RBD driver to
flatten image has been cloned >= rbd_max_clone_depth.
Although this configuration is used less, just in case, you may not
create a volume successfully if you do so.

Change-Id: I2d6b2c9dc6965979f9fa2f0295727c1ce844ca43
Closes-Bug: #1644129

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-07 21:18:53.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph cinder backup force-delete does not work

Ceph backup driver inherits from BackupDriver class where
by default the attribute support_force_delete is set to
False. For force delete to work, this attribute should
be set to true for the CephBackupDriver class.

Change-Id: I7812230fd6ed16c30c003487435c5444df81c9d7
Closes-Bug: #1595464
'}]
commit_message:
Ceph cinder backup force-delete does not work

Ceph backup driver inherits from BackupDriver class where
by default the attribute support_force_delete is set to
False. For force delete to work, this attribute should
be set to true for the CephBackupDriver class.

Change-Id: I7812230fd6ed16c30c003487435c5444df81c9d7
Closes-Bug: #1595464

Once it lands, we can reparent jobs to base-test to evaluate it.

commit_message:
Add event_time_to_live for panko config

By default panko keeps data for ever, exposing this will
help user tweak this setting and expire data periodically.

Partial-Bug: #1746514

Change-Id: Iac1b0def39a4beb9b0f86ad306a991d7822e8b4e

commit_message:
Added more information on building images

Added more information for building images on developement enviroment by
adding location to the build file for each kolla-build and location to
docker files for each image

Partially-Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla/+spec/queens-doc-restructure
Change-Id: I1d074070e76952ff7e015fed4b7c4dd81db228ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:14:29.000000000', 'message': 'Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I246aa6fb86a5f2c3a7a3cc9f537678ba8d3e2fdd
Closes-Bug: #1747453
'}]
commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I246aa6fb86a5f2c3a7a3cc9f537678ba8d3e2fdd
Closes-Bug: #1747453

commit_message:
Fix issue with missing url parameters

OSC uses these. project_id and tenant_id for neutron are interchangable.
If we list them in the QueryParameters list as project_id='tenant_id'
then a user can specify either. We'd done this for all of the *other*
Resources, but for some reason Network was left out.

ip_version is a valid query parameter for network_ip_availability, and
we even have it documented, but it's not in the list either.

We should have caught this before the last release - but actually only
just now got osc-functional-tips jobs turned back on. Sigh.

Change-Id: I1037dac37b15edbd2b8a17d7ed4ba639cf8e960b

commit_message:
set default for --type to an empty list

The action is set to append but the default is still None so if --type
is not provided on the command line the option's value isn't iterable
and trying to use it causes an exception.

Change-Id: I17e027088db305fac51a557e7005293d904cf890
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
list_constraints: handle unreleased deliverables

This commmand assumed all deliverables would have a release.
It will now capture this and print out a list at the end of
deliverables that did not include releases.

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Closes-Bug: #1747453

[{'created': '2017-02-07 05:00:05.000000000', 'message': 'Lefthand: create and restore volume backup fails

commit_message:
HPE StoreVirtual: create volume backup fails

When a user wants to perform parallel cinder backup volume
creation and restoration operation, lefthand driver ends the
execution with SERVER_ALREADY_EXISTS error.

While creating/restoring volume backups concurrently on HPE
StoreVirtual, lefthand driver tries to establish connection
between host and array. As the volume creation requests are
multiple and concurrent, multiple requests are being issued
for connection between host and array which should be in sync
to avoid the error.

Change-Id: Id0d183a9460abce70e839e828fcdc0de5d353bf2
Closes-Bug: #1662148

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 16:35:59.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Re-initialise volumes, encryptors, and vifs on hard reboot

We call _hard_reboot during reboot, power_on, and
resume_state_on_host_boot. It functions essentially by tearing as much
of an instance as possible before recreating it, which additionally
makes it useful to operators for attempting automated recovery of
instances in an inconsistent state.

The Libvirt driver would previously only call _destroy and
_undefine_domain when hard rebooting an instance. This would leave vifs
plugged, volumes connected, and encryptors attached on the host. It
also means that when we try to restart the instance, we assume all
these things are correctly configured. If they are not, the instance
may fail to start at all, or may be incorrectly configured when
starting.

For example, consider an instance with an encrypted volume after a
compute host reboot. When we attempt to start the instance, power_on
will call _hard_reboot. The volume will be coincidentally re-attached
as a side-effect of calling _get_guest_xml(!), but when we call
_create_domain_and_network we pass reboot=True, which tells it not to
reattach the encryptor, as it is assumed to be already attached. We
are therefore left presenting the encrypted volume data directly to
the instance without decryption.

The approach in this patch is to ensure we recreate the instance as
fully as possible during hard reboot. This means not passing
vifs_already_plugged and reboot to _create_domain_and_network, which
in turn requires that we fully destroy the instance first. This
addresses the specific problem given in the example, but also a whole
class of potential volume and vif related issues of inconsistent
state.

Because we now always tear down volumes, encryptors, and vifs, we are
relying on the tear down of these things to be idempotent.  This
highlighted that detach of the luks and cryptsetup encryptors were not
idempotent. We depend on the fixes for those os-brick drivers.

Depends-On: I31d72357c89db53a147c2d986a28c9c6870efad0
Depends-On: I9f52f89b8466d03699cfd5c0e32c672c934cd6fb

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to _create_domain_and_network
taking an additional disk_info argument in Ocata and the method for
getting instance disk info was named _get_instance_disk_info instead
of _get_instance_disk_info_from_config in Ocata.

Closes-bug: #1724573
Change-Id: Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986
(cherry picked from commit 3f8daf080411b84ec0669f0642524ce8a7d19057)

fully as possible during hard reboot. This means not passing

Because we now always tear down volumes, encryptors, and vifs, we are

highlighted that detach of the luks and cryptsetup encryptors were not

NOTE(melwitt): In Ocata, we don't go through os-brick to handle detach

this patch because of the re-initialization during hard reboot.

	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to _create_domain_and_network
taking an additional disk_info argument in Ocata and the method for
getting instance disk info was named _get_instance_disk_info instead
of _get_instance_disk_info_from_config in Ocata.

commit_message:
libvirt: Re-initialise volumes, encryptors, and vifs on hard reboot

We call _hard_reboot during reboot, power_on, and
resume_state_on_host_boot. It functions essentially by tearing as much
of an instance as possible before recreating it, which additionally
makes it useful to operators for attempting automated recovery of
instances in an inconsistent state.

The Libvirt driver would previously only call _destroy and
_undefine_domain when hard rebooting an instance. This would leave vifs
plugged, volumes connected, and encryptors attached on the host. It
also means that when we try to restart the instance, we assume all
these things are correctly configured. If they are not, the instance
may fail to start at all, or may be incorrectly configured when
starting.

For example, consider an instance with an encrypted volume after a
compute host reboot. When we attempt to start the instance, power_on
will call _hard_reboot. The volume will be coincidentally re-attached
as a side-effect of calling _get_guest_xml(!), but when we call
_create_domain_and_network we pass reboot=True, which tells it not to
reattach the encryptor, as it is assumed to be already attached. We
are therefore left presenting the encrypted volume data directly to
the instance without decryption.

The approach in this patch is to ensure we recreate the instance as
fully as possible during hard reboot. This means not passing
vifs_already_plugged and reboot to _create_domain_and_network, which
in turn requires that we fully destroy the instance first. This
addresses the specific problem given in the example, but also a whole
class of potential volume and vif related issues of inconsistent
state.

Because we now always tear down volumes, encryptors, and vifs, we are
relying on the tear down of these things to be idempotent.  This
highlighted that detach of the luks and cryptsetup encryptors were not
idempotent. We depend on the fixes for those os-brick drivers.

NOTE(melwitt): In Ocata, we don't go through os-brick to handle detach
of encrypted volumes and instead have our code under
nova/volume/encryptors/. We're already ignoring exit code 4 for "not
found" in cryptsetup.py and this makes luks.py consistent with that.
We need to be able to ignore "already detached" encrypted volumes with
this patch because of the re-initialization during hard reboot.

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to _create_domain_and_network
taking an additional disk_info argument in Ocata and the method for
getting instance disk info was named _get_instance_disk_info instead
of _get_instance_disk_info_from_config in Ocata.

Closes-bug: #1724573
Change-Id: Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986
(cherry picked from commit 3f8daf080411b84ec0669f0642524ce8a7d19057)

commit_message:
Expose a bug that cache invalidation doesn't work for application credential

This patch expose a bug that the cache invalidation
doesn't work for application credential when deleting
a application credential.

Mark the test as WIP for easy test and it'll be fixed
in the following patch.

Change-Id: I50b2a6b677a0a2d2e0ee62cbdc67e18bc03f67a8
Partial-bug: #1746868

subject: support cinder capacity statistics
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 20223, 'name': 'zhaolihui', 'email': 'zhaolh@awcloud.com', 'username': 'zhaolihui'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22752, 'name': 'Hanxi Liu', 'email': 'apolloliuhx@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hanxi_Liu'}, {'_account_id': 23037, 'name': 'Huachao Mao', 'email': 'mao.huachao@99cloud.net', 'username': 'huachaomao'}, {'_account_id': 23517, 'name': 'chenyb4', 'email': 'cybing4@gmail.com', 'username': 'Yuanbin.Chen'}, {'_account_id': 26159, 'name': 'xiexianbin', 'email': 'xiexianbin@yovole.com', 'username': 'xianbin'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-07 23:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-07 23:08:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Sean, could you provide some details as to what this notification is sending? i'm not sure what this is the capacity of? the amount of disk on each host? what is a pool?

right now i see it building https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/bd61cbda91915bcbcce2cb79f72c985ddc90e9b5/cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py#L762-L770 but i have no idea what a 'pool' or 'backend'"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-07 23:14:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192542/2/specs/liberty/cinder-capacity-notifications.rst for reviewers, this is the old spec which i don't understand."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-14 19:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry for the delay.

Cinder supports both multiple backends (managing multiple storage devices such as LVM, external iSCSI array, fibre channel array, etc.) and/or a single backend that divides up its available storage into one or more "pools" of storage.

The volume drivers that are used to manage these various backends are queried to get the available capacity of each device or pool within the device.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-14 21:02:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-14 21:05:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

i see. do you believe metric names are accurate? and it makes sense to treat pools as a subclassifier of backend/device? i may also tag the pool metrics with a 'host' metadata as well by ripping it from the name_to_id value."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-05 13:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Names look fine. "device" is the only part that I'm not 100%, but I don't really have a better suggestion.

These should be fairly accurate, or at least as accurate as the backend drivers are able to query from their managed devices.

I think treating pools as subclassifiers is the right way to go. That models the actual hierarchy of these storage backends.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-01-05 14:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23037, 'date': '2018-01-08 04:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-01-15 12:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-01-23 17:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-01-24 01:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22752, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

since sean thought it accurate for the metric description'}, {'account_id': 22752, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:03:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
support cinder capacity statistics

cinder sends a notification about its capacity:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/206923

for provider pool, the name_to_id is an concatenation of host#pool_name.

Change-Id: Ica0b55658ae9ac9ec1ed4ef5ab8cda450a139c7d
Implements: cinder-capacity-notifications

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I6ad634f65db855754e13b1c92dade4530afe1905

messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-03 22:26:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2018-02-05 07:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think it can be better if we support both of JSON and YAML format.
Following this change, if users want to use policy.yaml, it will not copy it.

Refer: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/aodh/tasks/config.yml#L12-L20'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-05 08:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've left a similar review to the RDO packaging today: let's generate the files instead of simply dropping them?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I've left a similar review to the RDO packaging today: let's
 > generate the files instead of simply dropping them?

Bifrost doesn't support automated configuration of policy.*. The use case here would be users manually modifying the policy file after installation?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:45:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I think it can be better if we support both of JSON and YAML
 > format.
 > Following this change, if users want to use policy.yaml, it will
 > not copy it.
 > 
 > Refer: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/aodh/tasks/config.yml#L12-L20

There is currently no support in bifrost for modifying the policy file as there is in kolla-ansible - this task was just copying the sample policy.json from the ironic repository.

The removal of the sample policy file from ironic has broken installation of bifrost, so I'd just like to concentrate on fixing that, rather than adding a new feature here."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:54:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I've left a similar review to the RDO packaging today: let's
 > > generate the files instead of simply dropping them?
 > 
 > Bifrost doesn't support automated configuration of policy.*. The
 > use case here would be users manually modifying the policy file
 > after installation?

It took just under a minute to generate the policy file on my laptop. That seems like a lot of time to add to the installation."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-05 10:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-05 11:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15362, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Allow missing ironic policy.json sample

Since ironic change I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792, the
sample policy.json is not present in the ironic repository. Since policy
is now in code, it is not required. This change only copies the sample
file to /etc/ironic when it exists in the ironic repository.

Change-Id: Iecdbd90b4c94556f5d0803e4340dfd6b473792c7

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Improve mariadb_recovery

The purpose of this change is to improve upon
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531122/

- Moved vars inside the defaults/main.yml file
- Made the regex for the lineinfile safer

Change-Id: Id581c0b36f3d4bd61d3627b8364b79296b967387
Closes-Bug: 1746567
Related-Bug: 1682153

Enables configuring Octavia flavor by default

Adds default flavor values for Octavia LB instances and enables flavor
creation by default.

commit_message:
Switch to ceph-ansible rolling_update on upgrade converge

We need to switch to a different ceph-ansible playbook on upgrade
converge step to trigger the actual Ceph upgrade.

Change-Id: I22c2d7f3a33b454df46173c76d0ede668ab9d064

commit_message:
Add validate_rescue() method to network interface

Adds validate_rescue() method to network interface to validate
rescuing network. This method is called by rescue.validate().

Change-Id: Iccac602047eec10f03ef6eaf2dbe716efd6e7f9a
Closes-Bug: #1747100

[{'created': '2018-01-31 18:38:55.000000000', 'message': 'Rework mariadb recovery tasks

In recover_cluster.yaml playbook the task to find the highest
seqno/Global Transaction ID is no longer relying only on grastate.dat
Instead it now follows the recommendations from galera cluster website
http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/restartingcluster.html

Closes-Bug: 1682153

Change-Id: I5fc3eaa8baee659576c4c39aef9cfd351c8e9af7
(cherry picked from commit cead8ec6235bfd4f8d36efcbab1f3d0a288cbd96)
'}]
commit_message:
Rework mariadb recovery tasks

In recover_cluster.yaml playbook the task to find the highest
seqno/Global Transaction ID is no longer relying only on grastate.dat
Instead it now follows the recommendations from galera cluster website
http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/restartingcluster.html

Closes-Bug: 1682153

Change-Id: I5fc3eaa8baee659576c4c39aef9cfd351c8e9af7
(cherry picked from commit cead8ec6235bfd4f8d36efcbab1f3d0a288cbd96)

commit_message:
Set disable:true for oci-machine-register

This is meant to help resolve an issue where systemd would stop
the docker service incorrectly. Often seeming to occur when a container
was in a restart state.

Change-Id: Ifb519f8ee7412ef486e709a19c1251a0f7e5d35e
Related-bug: #1733943

> (1 comment)

Yea, I think `index` function is equivalent to `before` is None. So I just drop it.'}, {'account_id': 21479, 'date': '2016-12-12 17:27:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Also I hope you see [1]:

The `index` function in nova API return {'instance_usage_audit_logs': task_log}, but I notice that the task_log is an object, not a list(differ from other `index` method), so it can't iterable, that to say if you call  base._list()(this will call ListWithMeta), it will raise an Exception: `ERROR (AttributeError): 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'`, so I just ignore this method.

In addition, I have not found any info about `index` in our latest docs.

As a result, I think the `index` method make no sense. If you need, I can call self.get() method with None `before` value. 

I'm really not sure my understand is rignt, looking forward to a better solution.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/instance_usage_audit_log.py#L43"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2016-12-13 18:22:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think we should ignore the index() method of nova's controller.  Remember, python-novaclient is intended for use as a library, as well as a command-line client.

Now, it's entirely possible that index() is buggy, and it might be worth starting a discussion on the dev list about what it is intended to do and what might be needed to fix it"}, {'account_id': 21479, 'date': '2016-12-14 05:43:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't think we should ignore the index() method of nova's
 > controller.  Remember, python-novaclient is intended for use as a
 > library, as well as a command-line client.
 > 
 > Now, it's entirely possible that index() is buggy, and it might be
 > worth starting a discussion on the dev list about what it is
 > intended to do and what might be needed to fix it

Hi, Kevin L. Mitchell. I have sent a mail about this topic to dev. However, Nova have been frozen for several days, so can we change the API?   If not in Ocata, can we just raise an  unimplemented exception in our client, once we fix the bug, we can rewrite the list() method."}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2016-12-14 11:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Co-Authored-by: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I4ef8e40c322f1768ee1b5e01e9681cab0e2804bd
'}]
commit_message:
Add CLI to show instance usage audit logs

Currently we can get instance usage audit logs via Nova API,
and the docs also update for it. It is necessary to add that
to our client and CLI.

This patch adds the following command.

nova instance-usage-audit-log [--before <before>]

Co-Authored-by: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I4ef8e40c322f1768ee1b5e01e9681cab0e2804bd

commit_message:
Deprecate aggregated disk.* metrics on instance

disk.* are just aggregates of disk.device.*. We
basically build the same think twice.

It's up to the backend (ie: Gnocchi) to aggregate them
if someone want the aggregate.

Change-Id: I612b575004f65665f8630f19f56c2fb3637448fd

commit_message:
trivial: Generate '{project}-doc' roles, not '{project}-doc-link'

The latter are overly verbose, while the former have a natural synergy
with the 'doc' role provided by Sphinx.

Change-Id: Ib2fd91c1115270d3eb7d8197efdf4b5e8a7316a9

measure to allow the nova LXD compute driver to work properly
with recent updates to LXD.

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.

Change-Id: I995c5ca3b012fd5275125e7a9d44e47ed08d60fb

commit_message:
Update pylxd to 2.2.4 upper constraint as fix for lxd 2.0.11

This overrides the upper-constraint for pylxd as a temporary
measure to allow the nova LXD compute driver to work properly
with recent updates to LXD.

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and
crashes out. This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4.

Change-Id: I995c5ca3b012fd5275125e7a9d44e47ed08d60fb
Related-Review: https://review.openstack.org/539174
Related-Source-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pylxd/+bug/1736454
Related-Bug: #1746068

For the record, unless the text of a commit message, comment, or docstring in question is totally garbled, I (and, I believe, most other core reviewers) don't typically recommend re-rolling a review just to fix up wording.  I may suggest spelling or grammatical changes from time to time, being somewhat of a grammar nerd, but I generally do so with the proviso that such changes be made if the review needs to be updated for some other reason, e.g., a rebase, some other comment from a reviewer that requires technical changes, etc.  Now if a developer goes ahead and updates a review after I make such a suggestion, I certainly won't quibble about it :)  But I wanted to take the opportunity to ensure everyone knows about that policy.

(Of course, documentation changes, including help strings in argument definitions, are another story, as we want to make sure those are as clear as possible for the benefit of those users who are not native English speakers)"}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-01-29 22:25:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-30 15:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

'}, {'created': '2018-01-22 19:56:36.000000000', 'message': 'Implement hypervisor hostname exact patten match for server cold migrate

    When starting cold migration with nova command "nova host-servers-migrate compute-1",
    the migration started from all compute hosts starting with name "compute-1", not only
    from compute-1 host. The same thing happens to "nova host-meta", "nova host-evacuate",
    "nova host-evacuate-live" as well.

    With the "--strict" option added to these nova commands, the action will be applied
    to a single compute with the exact hostname string match, but not to the computes
    with hostname substring match. Error handling is also added to these nova commands
    such that when specified hostname name does not exist, "NotFound" will be returned.

Closes-Bug: #1667794
Change-Id: I5610efa160864b0d91cd67961883a6bec5bb8dd0

commit_message:
Implement hypervisor hostname exact pattern match

    When starting cold migration with nova command "nova host-
    servers-migrate compute-1", the migration started from all
    compute hosts starting with name "compute-1", not only from
    compute-1 host. The same thing happens to "nova host-meta",
    "nova host-evacuate", "nova host-evacuate-live" as well.

    With the "--strict" option added to these nova commands, the
    action will be applied to a single compute with the exact
    hostname string match, but not to the computes with hostname
    substring match. Error handling is also added to these nova
    commands such that when specified hostname name does not exist,
    "NotFound" will be returned.

Closes-Bug: #1667794
Change-Id: I5610efa160864b0d91cd67961883a6bec5bb8dd0

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Hi Matt, Here I have implemented the fix which covers a boundary case. The code handles for one custom field and put it in the type 'Other', but if it gets more than one field it duplicates 'Others' in column field. This fix will not change the usability of novaclient in any case, just handles a boundary case which can fail for anyone. commit_message:
nova limits ERROR (Exception): Field names must be unique

Running `nova absolute-limits` or `nova limits` can fail
when unaccounted for limits are returned

This works OK for a standard Vanilla OpenStack deployment
today, but it is quite fragile if new limit types are
introduced, or if a deployer sends back
other custom limits.
For instance, my limits include `maxTotalPrivateNetworks`
and `totalPrivateNetworksUsed` limits, which do not map
accordingly, and thus result in an error.

This happens when 'Others' field(custom limit type) is
occuring more than once which is not handled in code
causing multiple columns having same name.
Which throws exception and does not pretty prints
absolute limit.

This fix should also fix any future custom limits.

Closes-bug: #1546767

Change-Id: I1d3cf707722fc71c20cf4ec517b3f4f4875480e0

commit_message:
Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. Nothing special is
required for this except for adding the appropriate distro variables
file and also update the zypper cache before package installation.

Change-Id: If07ef32f9e39272b4c7fadb438df33f188b186cd

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: Ibcfe3d69705833b0c743e6303feb351a464abdcf
(cherry picked from commit ae5def5f8faeae7702f77508ef3586f28ae19cc2)

commit_message:
tests: test-neutron-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop the verbosity
level a bit and let users increase it if desired.

Change-Id: I2be538861e51af5d51159de0bce73bf78c0eaca3

subject: Update sdk connection, tests and isoformat
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:13:00.000000000', 'message': "Update sdk connection, tests and isoformat

A few fixes to get things working.

We can simplify connection creation now. The Connection constructor
understands not to load yaml or env vars if it doesnt' receive a cloud
argument - so this can all be done in one step.

Update the mocks in the tests to work for the new calling pattern.

Finally - isoformat wasn't processing UTC+00:00. There are some
dark issues with how isoformats get passed around OpenStack, but this
fixes the unittest matching to account for UTC+00:00.

Change-Id: Ia2460ac221c795c81d01dc5279644c7b77d33e5f
"}]
commit_message:
Update sdk connection, tests and isoformat

A few fixes to get things working.

We can simplify connection creation now. The Connection constructor
understands not to load yaml or env vars if it doesnt' receive a cloud
argument - so this can all be done in one step.

Update the mocks in the tests to work for the new calling pattern.

Finally - isoformat wasn't processing UTC+00:00. There are some
dark issues with how isoformats get passed around OpenStack, but this
fixes the unittest matching to account for UTC+00:00.

Change-Id: Ia2460ac221c795c81d01dc5279644c7b77d33e5f

commit_message:
Add sysfs for FPGA test

I copy the data from my FPGA host evn.
It is used for test.

We do not need to pay attention on it.
I split the from the FPGA code logic in order to make
everyone's attention focus on the logic code review.

commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: Id4a0db7644a6ffc8a2a3b011ab09bad8e24b20c7
Closes-Bug: #1747453

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I0fb7872dbc2c295616c319cd7e373dd8e868b028
(cherry picked from commit 82fd8b6109d1976ae7a305297ac4fa4e44799589)

commit_message:
Add test coverage for volume types

This PS adds coverage for volume types policies, specifically
those that test creating, updating and deleting a volume type
which enforces "volume_extension:types_manage" [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/4ca4f644008f4c89edc472cacda19050367ba54a/cinder/policies/volume_type.py#L26

Change-Id: I38b88f7ab86635891141cda801b1ec9cf2758431

commit_message:
Correct manifest index of openstack git folders

Currently the manifest contains all the possible repositories
which would be present if a non-selective git clone was done,
rather than the actual resulting list of git folders.

This patch corrects the manifest to only contain the list of
what is actually there after the build process completes.

Change-Id: I20ad8d21d4a68f8daa30c730a08a134b0cc9c0d3
(cherry picked from commit 421e9055c492bc23febe3a5e8652ecb83fbf3afd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 14:57:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: Ib3d3d14a3a6222f4362def29b4765cf5bad3d285
(cherry picked from commit 712a9078da86d237e8f088463b00782b2cdf77b4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: Ib3d3d14a3a6222f4362def29b4765cf5bad3d285
(cherry picked from commit 712a9078da86d237e8f088463b00782b2cdf77b4)

commit_message:
Correct manifest index of openstack git folders

Currently the manifest contains all the possible repositories
which would be present if a non-selective git clone was done,
rather than the actual resulting list of git folders.

This patch corrects the manifest to only contain the list of
what is actually there after the build process completes.

Change-Id: I20ad8d21d4a68f8daa30c730a08a134b0cc9c0d3
(cherry picked from commit 421e9055c492bc23febe3a5e8652ecb83fbf3afd)

commit_message:
Update the repo-build test data

The data used to test the repo build was last updated quite
a long time ago. This patch simply updates the data in order
to ensure that it's a better reflection of the current state.

Change-Id: I384b1f7e753885cb5ff0dda1b5d0bd1950b99124

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I619f26e1de7eed17c481cbe4bd67d53dcc7023ff
Closes-Bug:#1693670

'}, {'created': '2018-01-31 21:57:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix OpenDaylight setup.

Devstack with oxygen snapshot was broken due to multiple reasons,
[1]. Recently a 8080 port was removed from jetty config and since default
port devstack use for ODL is 8087 it needed a jetty.xml update and
[2]. the other was org.apache.karaf.features.cfg had a little change of
format in feature boot. This patch fixes both the issues.

Change-Id: I3c2ad96b09ed5616afb425f6043870260843fa74

commit_message:
Fix OpenDaylight setup with oxygen.

Devstack with oxygen snapshot was broken due to multiple reasons,
[1]. Recently a 8080 port was removed from jetty config and since default
port devstack use for ODL is 8087 it needed a jetty.xml update and
[2]. the other was org.apache.karaf.features.cfg had a little change of
format in feature boot. This patch fixes both the issues.

Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>
Change-Id: I3c2ad96b09ed5616afb425f6043870260843fa74

commit_message:
Migrate "launch instance" user guide docs

This imports the "launch instance" end user guide docs from
the openstack-manuals repo. As part of the docs migration
in Pike, these were forgotten. The copied contents come from
the stable/ocata branch of openstack-manuals, and therefore
likely need some updating, but that could be done in follow up
changes. This is an initial import to (1) publish the content
again somewhere and (2) fix broken links in the cinder docs
for booting from volume.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/index.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Ia57c93ef1e72ccf134ba6fc7fcb85ab228d68a47 in pike.

Change-Id: Ie039322660fd0e2e0403843448379b78114c425b
Partial-Bug: #1714017
Related-Bug: #1711267
(cherry picked from commit 4ed5e81ee0a7df28547d87e28f2eabe395d4737d)

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I0a8a5ac589b121e3a3ee98979c53340a1467f45c
(cherry picked from commit ce44dc6a08698aa91800e2962f866b1b94420ece)

[{'created': '2018-02-02 10:21:46.000000000', 'message': "Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not
present in newton.

commit_message:
Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Backport note:
The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not
present in newton.

Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c

subject: Add oauthlib, tackerclient, and glareclient
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2018-01-23 17:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-01-29 21:37:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

glare and tacker aren't actually used in the undercloud.

this change includes 2 additional puppet manifests and installs 2 additional packages (plus deps) for the only purpose of supressing a Mistral error. the bug here is in Mistral logging, that should be fixed instead of this workaround.

afaict, this just makes our undercloud install slower for no good reason."}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-01-31 12:10:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm inclined to agree with James. This fix here needs to be done in Mistral, there is work that has been in the pipeline (but has stalled) that would fix this.

The correct fix would be... Mistral wants to move the OpenStack actions to mistral-extra. This would then be configurable and would let users enable specific sets of actions. We would then only enable the OpenStack project actions that are relevant to a TripleO undercloud.

This wont happen for Queens, however, I think it could be a reasonable goal for Rocky if time can be assigned to it.

Having said that, there is a potential workaround if a fix is required sooner. Mistral can be given a custom mapping.json with only the actions we want to enable. At the moment it defaults to everything. https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/mistral/actions/openstack/mapping.json

(I'll copy the relevant info to the bug)"}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am totally fine with that. Abandoning.'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add waiter to test_manage_snapshot_rbac to fix data race

This PS adds a waiter after attempting to manage a snapshot
in test_manage_snapshot_rbac to avoid data race conditions
causing the test to fail during resource_cleanup [0].

This also adds a clean up to the test which is currently missing.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/77/537977/1/check/patrole-admin/c4e6884/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-01_02_47_26_276336

Change-Id: Ib62a6d7ebbc5af43278c97fedce3a863ecfd3575

commit_message:
zypper: Respect proxy settings

Currently installing opensuse behind a proxy fails. This
patch adds and uses functions for calling zypper that
repects the proxy settins: no_proxy, http_proxy, https_proxy.

Change-Id: If623e392d51d5883a5d8c8e6c7676c8b5792888c
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 02:23:03.000000000', 'message': "Don't update RT in _allocate_network

The call to _update_resource_tracker from
_allocate_network is a carryover from old
times when _allocate_network would call
_instance_update which would update the
resource tracker generically for any state
change in an instance.

_update_resource_tracker calls rt.update_usage
which grabs the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE lock
which is the same lock used during claims and when
the update_available_resource periodic task runs.

The update_usage method can be a bit heavy weight
if you're not actually changing anything the
resource tracker cares about, because it's re-calculating
stats for the capabilities scheduler filter and it's
collecting new inventory from the virt driver and
potentially updating that inventory for the compute
node in placement.

So given all _allocate_network is doing is changing
the state on the instance, and the state it's changing
to has nothing to do with what the resource tracker
cares about (like deleting or shelve offloading an instance),
we shouldn't call rt.update_usage and hold that big
lock unnecessarily since it could hold up other
operations happening at the same time, like creating
instances.

Closes-Bug: #1732316

Change-Id: Ib588c31a4d2075f8730409d50c99dfb04180a9cd
(cherry picked from commit 7b0d5f7f347cb1c040595000d9d6987369dce2ab)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't update RT in _allocate_network

The call to _update_resource_tracker from
_allocate_network is a carryover from old
times when _allocate_network would call
_instance_update which would update the
resource tracker generically for any state
change in an instance.

_update_resource_tracker calls rt.update_usage
which grabs the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE lock
which is the same lock used during claims and when
the update_available_resource periodic task runs.

The update_usage method can be a bit heavy weight
if you're not actually changing anything the
resource tracker cares about, because it's re-calculating
stats for the capabilities scheduler filter and it's
collecting new inventory from the virt driver and
potentially updating that inventory for the compute
node in placement.

So given all _allocate_network is doing is changing
the state on the instance, and the state it's changing
to has nothing to do with what the resource tracker
cares about (like deleting or shelve offloading an instance),
we shouldn't call rt.update_usage and hold that big
lock unnecessarily since it could hold up other
operations happening at the same time, like creating
instances.

Closes-Bug: #1732316

Change-Id: Ib588c31a4d2075f8730409d50c99dfb04180a9cd
(cherry picked from commit 7b0d5f7f347cb1c040595000d9d6987369dce2ab)

commit_message:
Fix invalid UUIDs in test_compute.py

There were many places in test_compute.py that used plain strings where
the object was expecting a UUID, which caused lots of warning output
when running the tests. This patch replaces all such usages with proper
UUIDs.

Partial-Bug: #1606647

Change-Id: Ie3c4b3eea25f0f50d301b3a529ab836e7f789104

commit_message:
Fixed Suse Image to use link without build information

   It looks like they update the builds pretty often.  This change
   is to make it use the more generic link to the latest build
   that isn't changed as often.

Change-Id: I31d3b76e2b26c0ef5bfe1ec4a3f2dcc5c34f8f41
Closes-Bug: 1746604

bgpvpn: use directional per-port attachments for prefix routes

This allows to properly announce prefix routes to only the
RTs of the corresponding Port Associations.

The use of the profile parameter in openstacksdk's connection object has
been deprecated and is currently causing upgrade testing to fail.

subject: [WIP] Introduce DIB_USE_CACHE and use it in zypper-minimal
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21741, 'name': 'Andreas Florath', 'email': 'andreas@florath.net', 'username': 'florath'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'marcin.juszkiewicz+kolla@linaro.org', 'username': 'hrw'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-24 14:19:51.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Introduce DIB_USE_CACHE and use it in zypper-minimal

There are many places where caching of different artifacts (like tar
files, rpm, or debian packages).  There are currently a couple of
different solution when it comes to implementing locking - and some
elements completely ignore locking.  This leads to cases where
e.g. zypper stops with errors because the shared cache directory
changed.

The documented way is not to use these kind of caches and use some
other kind of caching - like squid.

Nevertheless there is currently no simple way telling elements that
use caching to stop this.

This patch introduces the environment variable 'DIB_USE_CACHE' which
is by default set to 1 (true).  This patch also changes the
zypper-minimal element to use this new variable.

Future patched can make use of this variable also for other elements.

Change-Id: Iab923e33fffc923d390abb28905856136a189c5f
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Introduce DIB_USE_CACHE and use it in zypper-minimal

There are many places where caching of different artifacts (like tar
files, rpm, or debian packages).  There are currently a couple of
different solution when it comes to implementing locking - and some
elements completely ignore locking.  This leads to cases where
e.g. zypper stops with errors because the shared cache directory
changed.

The documented way is not to use these kind of caches and use some
other kind of caching - like squid.

Nevertheless there is currently no simple way telling elements that
use caching to stop this.

This patch introduces the environment variable 'DIB_USE_CACHE' which
is by default set to 1 (true).  This patch also changes the
zypper-minimal element to use this new variable.

Future patched can make use of this variable also for other elements.

Change-Id: Iab923e33fffc923d390abb28905856136a189c5f
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
tasks: auth: Pass --unrestricted to Linux Grub2 entries

The password protection aims to only prevent users from editing the
menu entries not from booting the system altogether. Fedora is patching
the 10_linux file to use '--unrestricted' so all users can boot the
system. As such, we apply a similar patch to the rest of the distros.

Change-Id: I1390a330ea1f0b48e71fdcb548614d5582fffbd4
Link: http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/grub2.git/tree/0109-Don-t-require-a-password-to-boot-entries-generated-b.patch
Link: https://www.gnu.org/software/grub/manual/grub/html_node/Authentication-and-authorisation.html#Authentication-and-authorisation
Closes-Bug: 1735709
(cherry picked from commit 65dce4045a75e4a8533b51ffb2d47e4dcd9114a1)

commit_message:
Fix ansible-role-functional jobs

Create new jobs ansible-role-functional-* for ansible-role testing, we
need ssh to localhost enabled and sudo access. Otherwise, it's running
tox -e functional.

Update project-templates, remove extra ansible-role-functional platform
jobs that are not needed anymore.

This was tested in https://review.openstack.org/540779

Change-Id: I9c070893b24fffd1f528debfeb4b36e6a5ab8ca4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 19:29:34.000000000', 'message': 'Stop logging over websocket on logout

When a user logs out of the application, we correctly close the
websocket connection.  However, the logging mechanism still tries to
send messages over the closed connection.  This commit sets
`authenticated` value in the `logger` state to `false` upon logout in
addition to closing the websocket connection.  This informs the logging
system that no more messages should be sent.

Change-Id: Iaf365d78cf5e2b35c4f035a9f068266131940553
Closes-Bug: 1746583

system that no more messages should be sent.

Change-Id: Iaf365d78cf5e2b35c4f035a9f068266131940553
Closes-Bug: 1746583
'}]
commit_message:
Stop logging over websocket on logout

When a user logs out of the application, we correctly close the
websocket connection.  However, the logging mechanism still tries to
send messages over the closed connection.  This commit sets
`authenticated` value in the `logger` state to `false` upon logout in
addition to closing the websocket connection.  This informs the logging
system that no more messages should be sent.

Change-Id: Iaf365d78cf5e2b35c4f035a9f068266131940553
Closes-Bug: 1746583

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 17:02:37.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Implementation containerized VNF in Kubernetes

This spec proposes implementing containerized VNF. We choose
to use Kubernetes resources (ConfigMap, Deployment, Horizontal
Pod Autoscaler, Service, etc) to define a containerized VNF.

commit_message:
Implementation containerized VNF in Kubernetes type

This spec proposes implementing containerized VNF. We choose
to use Kubernetes resources (ConfigMap, Deployment, Horizontal
Pod Autoscaler, Service, etc) to define a containerized VNF.

1. Add "configurable_properties" type in VDU node.
2. Support translate TOSCA to Kubernetes templates.
3. Add kubernetes infra driver to support CRUD containerized
VNF.
Implements: blueprint containerised-vnfs

Change-Id: I706f1f325ca8c2b33debd7e6a13e81535245a5ad

subject: Implement containerized VNF in Kubernetes VIM

commit_message:
Implement containerized VNF in Kubernetes VIM

This spec proposes implementing containerized VNF in Kubernetes.
It focuses on CRUD C-VNF, other features will address in the future.

Change-Id: Idfb3db1803e16ebc34aa66e255445d1ff038da53
blueprint: containerised-vnfs
Co-Authored-By: Digambar Patil <digambarpat@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hyunsik Yang <yangun@dcn.ssu.ac.kr>

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id10cca447c55c7743446b0eefc1bf93e0999ccc4

According to the keystone documentation [1], there is no need
to define cache directives in keystone.conf, as long as the
global caching directive is enabled (all the components are
caching by default).

Change-Id: Ibd23343691de4e15c59649f880e5e3b035a5856b

commit_message:
Remove caching from keystone template

According to the keystone documentation [1], there is no need
to define cache directives in keystone.conf, as long as the
global caching directive is enabled (all the components are
caching by default).

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/identity-caching-layer.html

Change-Id: Ibd23343691de4e15c59649f880e5e3b035a5856b

commit_message:
Provide support matrix and doc for VGPU

Now that Queens supports attaching virtual GPUs to an instance, we need to
properly document which hypervisors support that, how to use that feature and
what the existing caveats are.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I871894c3584e92f80f6420dfc009e21b30450f8e
Implements: blueprint add-support-for-vgpu

commit_message:
doc: update the GPU passthrough HPC feature entry

This updates some busted links, adds ironic and powervm to the
table header, and copies a description from the admin guide.

Just a question.

Some URLs have 'latest' in the path. (e.g. https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/ )
This patch is for pike.
So should it replace 'latest' with 'pike'?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-01 04:35:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree that it might be better to point to the pike specific versions of the docs, but latest is probably better than ocata.

commit_message:
Fix tox_install.sh script

currently it actually hardcodes the horizon branch to install as
'master' with no way of overriding it via env var as it was intended.

Change-Id: Ia18353387b00e2807d69dcbeca08457bd662d26e
(cherry picked from commit 8bf9fbe04bdec54a77ca31b898943916619f2933)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 8932, 'name': 'Telles Mota Vidal Nbrega', 'email': 'tellesnobrega@gmail.com', 'username': 'tellesnobrega'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 13:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 14:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 15:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-10 17:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-10 17:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-10 21:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

One possible change:'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-11 10:44:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Luigi,'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-11 11:09:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Andreas, isn't the change in tox.ini enough?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-11 12:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

YEs, the change is enough to work correctly in OpenStack CI.

What if somebody calls the script outside of tox? With using master, it would fall back to the wrong branch. I suggested the change to be on the safe side. Alternative would be to fail if BRANCH is not set.

I find it normal to really hardcode stable/pike here instead of master if a value is set.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:04:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As the primary use case for the script is through tox, I would argue that it's the responsibility of people using it to set the variable.

Keeping the changes only in tox.ini means that, when a new stable change is created, only tox.ini should be patched (twice, for upper constraints and when that script is used); also, maintaining the same content helps identifying a duplicate file."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-12 17:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Either variant works - I have my preference but abstain from +1 here...'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-16 15:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Pavlo, up to you :)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-02 13:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Pavlo?'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-02-05 13:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-05 13:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-05 13:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Fix tox_install.sh script

currently it actually hardcodes the horizon branch to install as
'master' with no way of overriding it via env var as it was intended.

Additionally changed BRANCH_NAME to 'stable/pike' in tox.ini

Change-Id: Ia18353387b00e2807d69dcbeca08457bd662d26e
(cherry picked from commit 8bf9fbe04bdec54a77ca31b898943916619f2933)

commit_message:
Spawn ovn-northd for functional tests

Some functional tests need SBDB tables with valid data.
Mocking them will be difficult when a test is using
multiple SBDB tables and with multiple rows.
As ovn-northd will create SBDB data from NBDB,
we will be testing real functionality instead of mocking.

Also updated ovsdb_monitor functional tests, to bind and
unbind port to chassis and check if port status updated or not.

Change-Id: I07791ef3652ee7bdc55d1d8217c44ea1f74cedef

commit_message:
Switch cycle higlights to string list

The original thought was to have this contain rich formatting
like used in reno. But the reality is, for what this is used
for, we really just want a bulleted list of highlights for
each project.

Based on the first couple of patches, this has been a point of
confusion for those trying to use this directive. This patch
simplifies things by just treating the cycle-highlights as a
list that gets added as bullet items to the generated results.

Change-Id: If265606eb20fa3d49e3cf4a684ea683de4267927

Hi Seyeong,

Your change looks good but I think the commit message could use an update. Does the following look ok?

Fix ssl config update when api node is split

Currently, if we deploy cinder-api and cinder-volume to different nodes, ssl_key and ssl_cert don't get configured on the api node. commit_message:
Fix ssl config update when api node is split

Currently, if we deploy cinder-api and cinder-volume to different nodes,
ssl_key and ssl_cert don't get configured on the api node.

The ApacheSSLContext's __call__ method should gate on the 'api' service
being enabled, rather than 'cinder-common'.

Change-Id: I6d5d6710a73f9393ad7c45c3307925b10cda641d
Closes-bug: #1741479

commit_message:
Add a lookup plugin for nova servers

This change adds a lookup plugin to retrieve server information from
the Nova API. Results can be filtered by server attributes.

Change-Id: Ibbac1d5ce466f8c04d773d296f935ad555f7cb4d

The root cause is that kuryr-libnetwork doesn't have stable branch for pike, so the job clone the master version of kuryr-libnetwork, with pike's version of dependencies, which cause the failure.

commit_message:
Start RPC service before waiting

Stoping magnum-cond without having invoke start(),
results in "WARNING oslo_messaging.server Possible
hang: stop is waiting for start to complete".

A magnum instance with 16 workers was taking 1m to stop
with this change it takes 1 to 10 seconds. This change
doesn't break the fix in [1].

[1] If9e13effc14fd35e646d02bb4f568e79786aa958

Related-Bug: #1702349
Related issue in sahara:
Related-Bug: #1546119

Change-Id: Ied7ab43398d4e499514fa0bd5dba64971d1956bf

commit_message:
Using oslo_log instead of logging

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific logging (like
resource id's etc).

I think it's better to use the common logging module.

Change-Id: I3baefd043a557417e8317a80d57cc5a4a48ccc08

commit_message:
Configure qemu group setting as hugetlbfs for ovs-dpdk

Till now, the ovs service file and ovs-ctl command files
are patched to allow ovs to run with qemu group. In order
to remove this workarounds, a new group hugetlbfs is created
which will be shared between ovs and qemu. This patch contains
the changes required for applying these changes.

Depends-On: I674cbd45e17906448dd54acfdf7a7059880b7278
Change-Id: Iec6be0b99e84b0c89f791c3c9694fe10f3a1e7db

commit_message:
Update default scenarios from aio to aio_lxc

It looks like the `aio` scenario was renamed to `aio_lxc`, however
there are still a few references to `aio`.  This commit updates those
references to `aio_lxc`.

Change-Id: Ia080bc4f979cc9b29ea645725d25442edbb73668

[{'created': '2018-01-23 22:29:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix false positive server group functional tests

Most of the evacuate tests in nova.tests.functional.test_server_group
could produce false positive results becuase of multiple reasons:
* test did not wait for the migration to finish in done or error state
  before checked the instance host
* test did not asserted that the instance host is changed during the
  evacuation

Also the evacuation tests that starts up a third compute failed to add
the magic fake.set_nodes() call making the third node unusable and
causing unexpected NoValidHost during the evacuation. However it was
not visible until the above mistakes are fixed in the test

Closes-Bug: #1739013

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from methods in Pike that don't exist
in Ocata. Also, in Ocata, conductor doesn't set the migration status
to 'error' upon NoValidHost during rebuild so we can't wait for that
in the tests.

Change-Id: Idc4e3d8ac7c99c09c6f4860dc0c7a05f28a35627
(cherry picked from commit ec040527368a13cdc5ed427b21692be5bb2f28b6)
(cherry picked from commit 1558893de1e3af49fdeafd1c0d7e4c21ccbeb064)
"}, {'created': '2018-01-23 22:36:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix false positive server group functional tests

Most of the evacuate tests in nova.tests.functional.test_server_group
could produce false positive results becuase of multiple reasons:
* test did not wait for the migration to finish in done or error state
  before checked the instance host
* test did not asserted that the instance host is changed during the

Also the evacuation tests that starts up a third compute failed to add
the magic fake.set_nodes() call making the third node unusable and
causing unexpected NoValidHost during the evacuation. However it was
not visible until the above mistakes are fixed in the test

Closes-Bug: #1739013

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from methods in Pike that don't exist
in Ocata. Also, in Ocata, conductor doesn't set the migration status
to 'error' upon NoValidHost during rebuild so we can't wait for that
in the tests.

Change-Id: Idc4e3d8ac7c99c09c6f4860dc0c7a05f28a35627
(cherry picked from commit ec040527368a13cdc5ed427b21692be5bb2f28b6)
(cherry picked from commit 1558893de1e3af49fdeafd1c0d7e4c21ccbeb064)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix false positive server group functional tests

Most of the evacuate tests in nova.tests.functional.test_server_group
could produce false positive results becuase of multiple reasons:
* test did not wait for the migration to finish in done or error state
  before checked the instance host
* test did not asserted that the instance host is changed during the
  evacuation

Also the evacuation tests that starts up a third compute failed to add
the magic fake.set_nodes() call making the third node unusable and
causing unexpected NoValidHost during the evacuation. However it was
not visible until the above mistakes are fixed in the test

Closes-Bug: #1739013

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from methods in Pike that don't exist
in Ocata. Also, in Ocata, conductor doesn't set the migration status
to 'error' upon NoValidHost during rebuild so we can't wait for that
in the tests.

Change-Id: Idc4e3d8ac7c99c09c6f4860dc0c7a05f28a35627
(cherry picked from commit ec040527368a13cdc5ed427b21692be5bb2f28b6)
(cherry picked from commit 1558893de1e3af49fdeafd1c0d7e4c21ccbeb064)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: If7a78120f43934b9ab8936401abd880b036958ed

commit_message:
Remove broken job magnum-non-functional-tox-migration

This job cannot work, it calls 'tox -e migration' but there's no
migration environment.

Remove it, it's not needed and used.

Note that this is an alternative to change
https://review.openstack.org/537785 .

Change-Id: I38034695958b65c6d8abfa67ab51dfd719cb8ef6

To be able to correctly identify services are enabled or not to
run respective tempest tests, configure the same in devstack plugin
in proper way, instead of deciding the service availability based on

Change-Id: I9cbe3f1307b78d0e703069bc6c011b62c0d3c51f

commit_message:
Configure tempest service_availability correctly

To be able to correctly identify services are enabled or not to
run respective tempest tests, configure the same in devstack plugin
in proper way, instead of deciding the service availability based on
import of plugins.

Closes-Bug: #1743688
Change-Id: I9cbe3f1307b78d0e703069bc6c011b62c0d3c51f

[{'created': '2018-02-05 11:50:07.000000000', 'message': 'tempestconf is not in requirements, remove the check job

python-tempestconf requirements are manually handled because
it is used with various OpenStack releases, and it is indeed
not listed into projects.txt of requirements.git.

Change-Id: I17a33f7542febedfafa303cc3b0d20b36c247f9e

commit_message:
tempestconf is not in requirements, remove the check job

python-tempestconf requirements are manually handled because
it is used with various OpenStack releases, and it is indeed
not listed into projects.txt of requirements.git.

commit_message:
Enable heat support in telemetry-tempest-plugin

* Due to tempest plugin split migration and deprecation of
  `orchestration` flag in heat which is replaced with
  heat_plugins leads to skipping telemetry scenario tests.
* It updates the same and enable tests for the same.

Change-Id: Idd12dcb05322737b3d9b72eac902b969252ee4c3

Revert "Adds tags for inhibit and silence"

This reverts commit 8781a256f0c19662b81f04b014e2b769e625bd6b.
Since this only implements part of the silence / group / inhibit
feature, reverting until the rest is ready to go

messages: [{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-02-03 16:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2018-02-04 22:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nThis probably should be replicated onto the distgit spec as well, to be on the safe side ( https://github.com/rdo-packages/tripleo-common-distgit/blob/rpm-master/openstack-tripleo-common.spec / https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/q/project:openstack/tripleo-common-distgit )'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-03 16:18:19.000000000', 'message': "Add keystoneclient to requirements.txt

At some point on 2018-02-02, all tripleo-common tox python jobs started
failing with:

2018-02-02 15:05:50.952672 | ubuntu-xenial | ImportError: No module
named keystoneclient

We did't have python-keystoneclient in requirements.txt, though we
probably should. We must have been implicitly getting it from somewhere
else previously and something must have changed to where it's now
explicitly required.

Change-Id: I272292f2f411d1195e5986f0f6a24b379fbf2b6e
Closes-Bug: #1747160
"}]
commit_message:
Add keystoneclient to requirements.txt

At some point on 2018-02-02, all tripleo-common tox python jobs started
failing with:

2018-02-02 15:05:50.952672 | ubuntu-xenial | ImportError: No module
named keystoneclient

We did't have python-keystoneclient in requirements.txt, though we
probably should. We must have been implicitly getting it from somewhere
else previously and something must have changed to where it's now
explicitly required.

Change-Id: I272292f2f411d1195e5986f0f6a24b379fbf2b6e
Closes-Bug: #1747160

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: support directionnal attachments

Add possibility to attach a port only in a specific
direction: traffic to the port, from the port (or both,
by default).

Co-Author: ythomas1 <ythomas1.ext@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I479d2ca115c07667576b17353137934b1d8ab493

Ying, I am really feeling sad on your response. The horizon core team seems to think the refresh issue as a high priority problem considering two or three week review internal. Shu tried to propose several approaches but the reviewers put -1 because it is NOT a PERFECT solution but didn't show what is the right way to go. I believe this is the fault of the core team. I raised this topic as an agenda of the horizon meeting multiple time, but there seems no conclusion and deferred the conclusion.

I already discussed this topic with Shu and proposed several approaches, but you and Rob rejected all of them because they were not perfect solutions. I have no idea now. It is now your turn to propose a solution at least you satisfy if you don't agree a compromise.

Is a compromise really bad compared to the internal server error? I would like to see some gradual approach unless you have a clear view on the way to address the bug.

As a solution you mentioned, what do you propose as "different resource types"? It is still unclear.

I don't think "different resource types" is the right way to go. It sounds like an invention of another type of "admin" or "project" resource. I am thinking NG::Detail is a wrong approach as long as horizon goes to the route of having "admin" dashboard.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-24 19:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Akihiro, I am sorry that my review comment upset you. I understand that this is a critical bug to fix, and that's why I reviewed it. I think a better place to put this comment is on the patch depends on it: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/491346, where the default index url needs to be set on different files. So I suggested to put them in a map instead. Would be better if these two patches are combined together but it's okay. 

I really think refreshing the admin image details panel should stay in the same url though. Can't we pass something from the django view to the angular details view to determine if it's a project or admin panel?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-12 04:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We discussed how we can move this forward in the meeting this week [1].
A rough consensus is we this kind of workaround is needed for Queens and it seems better to revisit the URL structure in Rocky so that the URL contains a dashboard information.

There is no way to determine a dashboard (project/admin/identity/..) which a panel belongs to from a URL. The NG::Detail URL has no information on a dashboard and this is the root cause of the problem. To address this problem completely, we need to revisit the URL structure.

commit_message:
Enable to refresh ngdetails view

For now, refreshing ngdetails view by browser using F5 key or reload
button, it causes 404 error from django. To fix this issue, this patch
adds the url for '/ngdetails' into django.

To reproduce navigations, each request for views.py requires
'dashboard' and 'panel' object. Otherwise django side returns
500 error.

However the URL for request of details page (i.e. /ngdetails/)
can not provide informations to set the proper navigation.

So this patch set them to default dashboard and default panel.

This patch focuses to prevent 500 error. So the issue for
settings of proper navigation will be fixed by subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Ib9f1fe48b3cdecff5ad56e68a5ba58a41cb35f38
Closes-Bug: #1681627

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Fix Zuul v3 file name

Zuul v3 currently only parses .yaml files, rename the file.

remove the project name stanza, it is not needed and will harm with
project renames. The current automated changes will not catch this, as
this basically is a new name.

Also, remove .zuul.yaml - we don't need both files. And the noop
template is just wrong for this project since it has jobs.

Change-Id: I112711a28d9635cb9eaa6f788e1747b20596701b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I26fc0d6ad8a9d0da4ae7e4ab28db16873da292bc

[{'account_id': 27181, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:59:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-05 10:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
the tacker service failed to start after tacker.conf was configured.
the detail reason is as follows:
ERROR configuration:
[database]
connection = mysql://tacker:<TACKERDB_PASSWORD>@<MYSQL_IP>:3306/tacker?charset=utf8
Correct configuration:
[database]
connection = mysql+pymysql://tacker:<TACKERDB_PASSWORD>@<MYSQL_IP>:3306/tacker?charset=utf8

Change-Id: If1360145754c3e9836666e17d924b8a261f9626b
