commit_message:
Correct manifest index of openstack git folders

Currently the manifest contains all the possible repositories
which would be present if a non-selective git clone was done,
rather than the actual resulting list of git folders.

This patch corrects the manifest to only contain the list of
what is actually there after the build process completes.

Change-Id: I20ad8d21d4a68f8daa30c730a08a134b0cc9c0d3
(cherry picked from commit 421e9055c492bc23febe3a5e8652ecb83fbf3afd)

commit_message:
Ensures that all classes have the same interface as their parents

VMUtils10 has a few extra methods when compared to VMUtils. This
patch adds those methods to VMUtils (raising NotImplementedError).

Adds unit test that checks for future inconsistentcies.

ISCSIInitiatorCLIUtils has been deprecated and removed, but it was
not removed from utilsfactory.utils_map. This patch addresses this
issue.

Closes-Bug: #1746986

Change-Id: I2a963304fc67595bc18e719e6b4420f553519c41

'}, {'created': '2018-01-31 18:51:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix boolean types in db migration tests

In gate py27 and py35 unit tests are failing on
alembic migration tests with exceptions like this [1].
Apparently sqlAlchemy 1.2.1 enforces type checks for
database fields that 1.1.15 just coerced.

Change strings to booleans and ints in the test
code so that fields in the "fakes" match the
fields in the sqlalchemy models.

Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/68/539468/1/check/openstack-tox-py27/db4a572/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-31_09_26_49_316004

Change-Id: Iadffb8a06b4d948d77fc00b85118e538b0a19b24
'}]
commit_message:
Fix boolean types in db migration tests

In gate py27 and py35 unit tests are failing on
alembic migration tests with exceptions like this [1].
Apparently sqlAlchemy 1.2.1 enforces type checks for
database fields that 1.1.15 just coerced.

Change strings to booleans and ints in the test
code so that fields in the "fakes" match the
fields in the sqlalchemy models.

Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/68/539468/1/check/openstack-tox-py27/db4a572/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-31_09_26_49_316004

Change-Id: Iadffb8a06b4d948d77fc00b85118e538b0a19b24

commit_message:
Support host recovery

This patch adds a host recovery feature to the host monitor plugin.
When recovery of a failed host is detected, it updates the reservable
field of the host to True.

Note that this status change does not trigger healing of degraded
leases. The recovered hosts can be re-reserved by calling Create/Update
lease request.

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: Ie6767902a9d7dc60b3fa6c525a9a1270578ea49b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I27533519a8d77bae6fb58b61bf41daf5fca50d3c

commit_message:
Reduce Nova API calls in the host polling monitor

This patch replaces the Show Hypervisor Details with the List
Hypervisors to reduce Nova API calls.

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: I89fb1d9898455eb1f3f998508b9d53c08aaf1302

commit_message:
Implement host notification monitor plugin

This patch implements the notification_callback() of the host monitor
plugin. It check health of hosts by parsing notification messages.
If it detects failures, it tries to heal related reservations.

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring

Change-Id: I8f71001a6e78cda956ca315351591e68235406d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 03:26:38.000000000', 'message': 'Implement host polling monitor plugin

This patch implements the poll() of the host monitor plugin. It checks
health of hosts by calling Nova Hypervisors API. If it detects
failures, it tries to heal related reservations by calling new
heal_reservations() methods of resource plugins.

This patch also implements the heal_reservations() method of the host
plugin. It allocates alternative resoruces and returns reservation
flags to update.

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: I05873a161412742d7862235da0db4ff2fa57b0ca

plugin. It allocates alternative resoruces and returns reservation

commit_message:
Implement host polling monitor plugin

This patch implements the poll() of the host monitor plugin. It checks
health of hosts by calling Nova Hypervisors API. If it detects
failures, it tries to heal related reservations by calling new
heal_reservations() methods of resource plugins.

This patch also implements the heal_reservations() method of the host
plugin. It allocates alternative resoruces and returns reservation
flags to update.

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: I05873a161412742d7862235da0db4ff2fa57b0ca

commit_message:
Fix a potential error about script file

It would cause "Permission denied" error because of the lack of execute
permission on the script file.

Change-Id: If7462fa277d114dbf0ebd7e4c0cd2256b4f29c87

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I43b8a36e6ba8457c9594dc4ad579167f95d91d39

[{'created': '2018-02-03 16:17:31.000000000', 'message': 'Convert ansible-role-functional jobs

All repositories using these tests have a functional tox environment, so
use the default tox functional jobs for these.

commit_message:
Convert ansible-role-functional jobs

All repositories using these tests have a functional tox environment, so
use the default tox functional jobs for these.

Create new variants for testing on Fedora and CentOS.

Change the project-templates to use the new jobs and
move the now native templates to project-templates files.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/540602
Change-Id: I1abca098710fc348fbfa66180fcdd43b54327687

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Iecfb1a20f3a62216dc9033dcb51456d9788c791f

'}, {'created': '2018-01-24 16:10:21.000000000', 'message': "Add checking whether current FWaaS L2 driver support for a port or not

Currently, FWaaS L2 driver based ovs only works correct with ports,
which are landed at compute nodes with sg_driver=openvswitch in
coexistence mode. There is a port, which is landed at compute node with
sg_driver=iptables_hybrid, if user try to attach this port to a FWG.
Then, firewall group won't works as user expected as case of
sg_driver=openvswitch. That seem bad experience. So this patch prevent
attaching a port, which are not support fully by firewall group driver
at the moment. In future if FWG can support not only hybrid port but
also for other ports (e.g vm ports are landed at compute node with
mechanism driver is linuxbridge), we can consider remove this checking. 


Change-Id: Ib0a85b55840d8dfe6bcae91484a0440902d3c49a

"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 04:15:13.000000000', 'message': "Validating if a port is supported by FWaaS V2

Currently, FWaaS L2 driver based ovs only works correctly with
vm ports, which are landed at compute nodes with:
    * mechanism_driver=openvswitch
    * firewall_driver=noop or openvswitch for security group

If you try to add a vm port to a FWG, which is landed at compute
nodes with:
    * mechanism_driver=linuxbridge and firewall_driver=iptables
    * mechanism_driver=openvswitch and firewall_driver=iptables_hybrid
Then, FWaaS V2 API  won't work correctly.

So this patch validates if vm ports are supported fully by FWaaS L2
driver at this moment. In the future, if FWG can support not only
hybrid port but also other ports, we can remove this validation.

Change-Id: Ib0a85b55840d8dfe6bcae91484a0440902d3c49a

commit_message:
Validating if a port is supported by FWaaS L2 driver

Currently, FWaaS L2 driver based OVS only works correctly with
VM ports, which are landed at compute nodes with:
    * mechanism_drivers=openvswitch
    * firewall_driver=noop or openvswitch for security group

If you try to add a VM port to a FWG, which is landed at compute
nodes with:
    * mechanism_drivers=linuxbridge and firewall_driver=iptables
    * mechanism_drivers=openvswitch and firewall_driver=iptables_hybrid
Then, FWaaS V2 API  won't work correctly.

So this patch validates if VM ports are supported fully by FWaaS L2
driver at this moment. In the future, if FWaaS L2 driver can support
not only hybrid port but also other ports, we can remove this validation.

Change-Id: Ib0a85b55840d8dfe6bcae91484a0440902d3c49a
Closes-Bug: #1746855

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I3c4146034f42a55ab4d432f61d443f714d4a5ae6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-04 15:38:52.000000000', 'message': "Remove jobs from project-config-example

The repo project-config-example is showing a Zuul v2 config - and their
tests expect a Zuul v2 setup. Remove the legacy jobs since they do not
work anymore with zuul repository now at v3 - there's not much sense in
converting these jobs to native Zuul v3 syntax.

Change-Id: Icdadba3eceeefea160963ed59e371b0d79feb02f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove jobs from project-config-example

The repo project-config-example is showing a Zuul v2 config - and their
tests expect a Zuul v2 setup. Remove the legacy jobs since they do not
work anymore with zuul repository now at v3 - there's not much sense in
converting these jobs to native Zuul v3 syntax.

Change-Id: Icdadba3eceeefea160963ed59e371b0d79feb02f

commit_message:
Remove release notes from docs

Release notes should be created automatically by the docs creation tool.
Having them in the tree (and in index.rst) breaks RPM packaging.

Change-Id: I24733ce7fab557aa0e288e9b021f0d43a338c06e
(cherry picked from commit 599f56fed91cd0d9606050bceab1169f64bd68aa)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I14d4f7dd74e339cfaeb7855c7b0885427668e419

[{'created': '2018-01-25 02:01:01.000000000', 'message': "Environment to disable Neutron networks

This environment disables the creation of Neutron networks
created by the network isolation templates and environments.
It is useful if you want to create a second stack of servers
alongside of 'overcloud' which shares the same network space.

For example: an OpenShift/Kubernetes cluster.

Change-Id: I649135627c4a499c080a320fc5a6af8d490ed91e
"}]
commit_message:
Environment to disable Neutron networks

This environment disables the creation of Neutron networks
created by the network isolation templates and environments.
It is useful if you want to create a second stack of servers
alongside of 'overcloud' which shares the same network space.

For example: an OpenShift/Kubernetes cluster.

Change-Id: I649135627c4a499c080a320fc5a6af8d490ed91e

[{'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2017-12-06 21:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-06 21:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2017-12-06 21:24:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not particularly against this change although making this a default on every job everywhere is certainly not a good practice.

Any operations done by a user can have an influence on the jobs and we could either cause jobs to fail by mistake or in the worst case scenario, end up making a job pass the gate and merge a broken change.

The nodes will also be deleted automatically as soon as the job is finished which might not give you the time you need to understand what is going on.
Infra has the ability to hold nodes on a need basis to prevent deletion and I think they're reasonable about helping projects resolve otherwise difficult problems.

I haven't personally come across many requests for holding nodes, I'm sure if we ask nicely they'll help -- however, if this is something that is needed on a regular basis, we have other problems."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-06 21:38:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

David does make some good points, perhaps this patch shouldn't be the default.  It might make sense to keep this patch around for testing via Depends-On: but perhaps not an expectation that it's always available."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-06 21:54:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@David, @Alex, it's not for all jobs everywhere, it's only for RH1 and RDO clouds - which we do control. It's not for openstack-infra clouds (please see separate https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517928/ ) 

I didn't know it's possible to hold node, if it's so - then great, even better. 

We have here a very limited list of people allowed to connect and these people know what they do. I used this to connect to nodes during job on the fly and investigate issues even without holding node and found it extremely useful, especially when it's hardly reproducible.

That's why I think it's very helpful and we should have it by default, without using Depends-On."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-06 22:14:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yea I realize it's for rdo/rh1 clouds and I'm not blocking this right now, but I would like to better understand why direct access to the machines is a must have all the time.  This kinda goes hand-in-hand with my ask of being able to recreate CI externally in a simple way. If we continue to just bypass that by directly giving CI folks access to the boxes to debug, then developers, operators and customers do not benefit from additional tooling for these purposes. 

For example the recent issues with ovsdbapp uncovered our incorrect setting of debug for neutron agents[0][1]. By not just going onto the machines and debugging it, we were able to identify a user experience issue and fix it.  Yea it may be harder up front, but the outcome is better for others if we have the appropriate logging and tooling already baked in.


[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521191/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521258/"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-07 00:42:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Alex, reproducing CI externally doesn't contradict with this access and doesn't replace it in any way. I think in the end of next week everybody will be able easily reproduce CI, the team is working on this right now. 

This access is for cases when even reproducing CI doesn't help - for example if it's very rare reproducible. In this case making life harder for investigators isn't justified."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:48:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I didn't say reproducing efforts and access to CI need to be mutually exclusive. What I'm saying is that efforts should first be to improve our ability to understand what we're missing and requiring ssh access to debug/understand.  In my past experiences I've had access to CI environments where devs could turn a failed environment back on for debugging/research purposes and it was glorious. Unfortunately the existing upstream tripleo-ci is not setup like this so this seems like a hack to temporarily provide access during the run rather than coming up with a system where you could actually reproduce problems and debug.  Like I said, I'm not blocking. Just asking for additional details around the justifications.  

I am neither a tripleo admin nor do I have access to the RH clouds so in thinking about this further it's not exactly my place to say if the tripleo admins should actually have access to the nodes on RH clouds. It would be beneficial to get feedback from the owners of the various RH clouds on if this is permissible/a good idea.  David points out that this could possibly cause instability or other technically invalidate the testing.  Unlikely, but it is a concern.

Additionally to your argument around if it's a very rare case. We've seen that it's unlikely that you'll be able to ssh in to the node and catch it so this seems to be a nice to have but is it something that would actually be beneficial? And if it is really useful what specifically are you doing when you ssh in that you cannot get by another means?"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-12-11 09:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Alex, @David, is it better now? Access will have now only people that actually work on CI and fix its issues.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2017-12-12 13:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:33:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'd prefer if you didn't merge this.  We offer tools today to help reproduce job failures outside of the gate, see reproduce.sh for devstack. This means, there is no need for people to require root access to the running nodes. The effort should be spend there to make it easier to debug tripleo jobs.

But adding your SSH key into the nodes and modifying running jobs behind zuuls back, this is not going to end well IMO. Aside from the first issue, that zuul can delete the node at will or opens up the ability for a user to force a failing job to pass.

If you need access to a node, we have the ability to set an autohold in zuul and then add your credentials to said node, as david points out.  This should be method used downstream in RDOCloud.

I should also not, no other project requires this today. Please reach out to openstack-infra more so we can help assist with the need for root access to a running job."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-02-05 07:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Change-Id: I7af37346fd6f99e162d0ffa6c9218ba00b92f9c7

It's used for connections and live investigations of problem on

commit_message:
Install SSH keys of TripleO CI team on RH clouds

Install SSH keys of TripleO CI team on nodepool images on RH1 and
RDO clouds.
It's used for connections and live investigations of problem on
nodes.

Change-Id: I7af37346fd6f99e162d0ffa6c9218ba00b92f9c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 17:04:35.000000000', 'message': 'inspector: fix perms on /var/lib/ironic

This patch fixes permissions on the /var/lib/ironic directory when
it gets used by ironic-inspector. It was previously getting owned as
root:root which causes functional issues with the ironic-conductor
service on the same node which expects it to be ironic:ironic.

Change-Id: I408f791af1d6dca059836efc197d814ec63f942d
Closes-bug: #1746553
'}]
commit_message:
inspector: fix perms on /var/lib/ironic

This patch fixes permissions on the /var/lib/ironic directory when
it gets used by ironic-inspector. It was previously getting owned as
root:root which causes functional issues with the ironic-conductor
service on the same node which expects it to be ironic:ironic.

Change-Id: I408f791af1d6dca059836efc197d814ec63f942d
Closes-bug: #1746553

Following best practice recommendations [1], monkey_patch in

commit_message:
eventlet.monkey_patch upfront in __init__

Following best practice recommendations [1], monkey_patch in
congress/server/__init__.py,
congress/cfg_validator/agent/__init__.py,
and congress/tests/__init__.py (previously done)
 to ensure all modules are patched very first thing
and no unpatched modules get used.

All other uses of eventlet.monkey_patch are removed.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/eventlet-best-practices.html

Change-Id: Id98f9f9a6f21ca56dd0c1facba6ca4ea064e9352

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I390d674b3cc667c4013929bc13e98eb4fffbf35b

commit_message:
Fix get_compute_node_by_hostname in nova_helper

If hostname is different from uuid in Compute CDM,
get_compute_node_by_hostname method returns empty.
This patch set fixes to return a compute node even if hostname
is different from uuid.

Change-Id: I6cbc0be1a79cc238f480caed9adb8dc31256754a
Closes-Bug: #1746162

subject: Allow admin to create port on networks of different projects
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-16 15:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2018-02-05 05:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 15:42:14.000000000', 'message': "Allow admin to create port on networks of different projects

Due to the change in the neutron API wrapper [1],
admin cannot create a port on networks owned by different project.
This is because api.neutron.network_get returns subnet detail
(Subnet object) only when project_id matches that of a target network.
This commit changes the logic to try to retrieve subnet detail first.
The condition is not simple and it looks wise to let neutron decide it.

The error reported in the bug also happens in the Port Create form
in the project dashboard if a user tries to create a port on an
external network. To handle the situation, handle() in CreatePort form
honors whether subnet detail is retrieved or not by checking a subnet
information is an instance of api.neutron.Subnet class.
This is a bit tricky but considering the current policy for create_port
I believe it is a good compromise.

Also fixes the wrong initial value of 'specify_ip' field of CreatePort
form. The initial value should be one of choices or None. Otherwise,
when 'specify_ip' field is hidden, an error message is returned
(though the message is not visible in the form), a user cannot submit
the form and the form is displayed continuously....

[1] commit 803209e237ea2987cfa2fad5f0e07a8c30d6d901

Closes-Bug: #1645708
Change-Id: I6aae0a29eedebc920247912fec0729bf47cda002
(cherry picked from commit 15d996f7e421c7de9ab4e87333a3c9824b307e5e)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow admin to create port on networks of different projects

Due to the change in the neutron API wrapper [1],
admin cannot create a port on networks owned by different project.
This is because api.neutron.network_get returns subnet detail
(Subnet object) only when project_id matches that of a target network.
This commit changes the logic to try to retrieve subnet detail first.
The condition is not simple and it looks wise to let neutron decide it.

The error reported in the bug also happens in the Port Create form
in the project dashboard if a user tries to create a port on an
external network. To handle the situation, handle() in CreatePort form
honors whether subnet detail is retrieved or not by checking a subnet
information is an instance of api.neutron.Subnet class.
This is a bit tricky but considering the current policy for create_port
I believe it is a good compromise.

Also fixes the wrong initial value of 'specify_ip' field of CreatePort
form. The initial value should be one of choices or None. Otherwise,
when 'specify_ip' field is hidden, an error message is returned
(though the message is not visible in the form), a user cannot submit
the form and the form is displayed continuously....

[1] commit 803209e237ea2987cfa2fad5f0e07a8c30d6d901

Closes-Bug: #1645708
Change-Id: I6aae0a29eedebc920247912fec0729bf47cda002
(cherry picked from commit 15d996f7e421c7de9ab4e87333a3c9824b307e5e)

commit_message:
extract_messages: Specify input directory

Currently horizon/locale/{django,djangojs}.js contain strings from
openstack_dashboard and vice versa. To avoid this, --input-dirs
option needs to be passed to python setup.py extract_messages.

Change-Id: Iee874616f4c037cc68bc3b0c7d8586d86f7153f4
Closes-Bug: #1710396
(cherry picked from commit 19a4012b9119643a612cf5d61be5c7d8ed128a65)

commit_message:
Make icmp_type/code optional

In Neutron API icmp_type/code are not required fields,
so they should be optional.

Previously we support Nova API which requires icmp_type
and icmp_code but we dropped Nova security group API support in Pike
and we no longer need to care it.

Change-Id: Ie460e763928b4f50f84c38d88556df632078ba42
Closes-Bug: #1712025
(cherry picked from commit c6c24eda59f8203f112125a4d1c073158576dd6b)

subject: Show subnet detail with prefix_delegation subnetpool properly
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-16 15:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2018-02-05 04:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 15:54:09.000000000', 'message': "Show subnet detail with prefix_delegation subnetpool properly

Subnet pool ID 'prefix_delegation' is a special subnet pool in Neutron
and there is no real subnet pool with ID 'prefix_delegation',
so we need to skip subnetpool_get() call
if a subnet has 'prefix_delegation' subnet pool.

This commit also adds unit tests which covers subnet pool operations
in the subnet detail view.

Change-Id: I3227a92084ee79b60d2b10262ed94a034e396306
Closes-Bug: #1702466
(cherry picked from commit 5de6b3eb14e414364bc115225d6067e3a87ad0ac)
"}]
commit_message:
Show subnet detail with prefix_delegation subnetpool properly

Subnet pool ID 'prefix_delegation' is a special subnet pool in Neutron
and there is no real subnet pool with ID 'prefix_delegation',
so we need to skip subnetpool_get() call
if a subnet has 'prefix_delegation' subnet pool.

This commit also adds unit tests which covers subnet pool operations
in the subnet detail view.

Change-Id: I3227a92084ee79b60d2b10262ed94a034e396306
Closes-Bug: #1702466
(cherry picked from commit 5de6b3eb14e414364bc115225d6067e3a87ad0ac)

subject: Fix the error format of glance's createImage
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-16 15:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2018-02-05 04:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 15:44:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix the error format of glance's createImage

Uppon failure, the createImage function returned a raw xhr error
that was incompatible with the wizard modal, making it display
the [Object object] error.

This change makes it so a generic error message is thrown directly
if it's not an handled glance error, so it could be shown on top of
the wizard modal.

Change-Id: I637bf1002630fe21f5ad20a7a047ec65ebc052dc
Closes-bug: #1703708
(cherry picked from commit 09a2afef35a2428ed7a551a3f16247e815fbabbd)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the error format of glance's createImage

Uppon failure, the createImage function returned a raw xhr error
that was incompatible with the wizard modal, making it display
the [Object object] error.

This change makes it so a generic error message is thrown directly
if it's not an handled glance error, so it could be shown on top of
the wizard modal.

Change-Id: I637bf1002630fe21f5ad20a7a047ec65ebc052dc
Closes-bug: #1703708
(cherry picked from commit 09a2afef35a2428ed7a551a3f16247e815fbabbd)

commit_message:
Set default panel of identity with pluggable settings mechanism

The way of setting default panel of project dashboard and admin
dashboard is the "pluggable settings" mechanism, but for identity
dashboard, a traditional "hard-coded" way is used. It's a good
idea to make it consistent with other dashboards.

Change-Id: I52c584b5ef4981ede981385d39615ab8e7922abe
Closes-Bug: #1717932
(cherry picked from commit 1eb9596a8dc30987f532de989e997df0aeb07b2f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 06:04:18.000000000', 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=1.12.0

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct
date handling, but when converting this value there is a slight
difference where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC",
but on python 3 they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: I9fcc55b36178ff88795e1d8e14da349e338a7392
Closes-bug: #1744160

commit_message:
Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on
python 3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone
information instead of its own implementation.
This does not change direct date handling, but when converting
this value there is a slight difference where now python 2.x
will show UTC times as "UTC", but on python 3 they will end up
with "UTC+00:00".
The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values.

Closes-bug: #1744160
Change-Id: I9fcc55b36178ff88795e1d8e14da349e338a7392

commit_message:
Revert "Support the option volume_binds of docker run"

This revert is necessary for fixing the breakage of the CLI.
The breakage is due to the fact that this feature hasn't been
implemented yet in server. We need to wait for the server
patch [1] to be merged before considering merging the patch in
client side.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512000/

Closes-Bug: #1747280
This reverts commit c19ffb5a0201081da36f58366185b450f818990b.

Change-Id: I177444be609d089716d8d3cf45a285ec9f0b1b31

commit_message:
Remove Octavia LBaaS service plugin from neutron config

Neutron no longer accesses Octavia using a service plugin so this
configuration can be removed.

Change-Id: I39db11a74a48afc99e716a31ad564c055d7f67d0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 15:46:24.000000000', 'message': "Add render method to ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple

Django 1.11+ doesn't have RenderMixin class for widgets, so we have to
implement render method for ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple to get it
rendered in a correct way with all supported Django versions until we
find a better solution for our widgets implementation.

Change-Id: I656afb162e130f2b77853368945b74330bedf747
Closes-Bug: #1715066
(cherry picked from commit c13d6da80e7a68c28aa0adfe63459be8a6dbedfd)
"}]
commit_message:
Add render method to ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple

Django 1.11+ doesn't have RenderMixin class for widgets, so we have to
implement render method for ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple to get it
rendered in a correct way with all supported Django versions until we
find a better solution for our widgets implementation.

Change-Id: I656afb162e130f2b77853368945b74330bedf747
Closes-Bug: #1715066
(cherry picked from commit c13d6da80e7a68c28aa0adfe63459be8a6dbedfd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 07:20:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add Cyborg SPDK Driver

SPDKDRIVER is a virtual interface which provides common methods
for specific drivers (such as: VHOSTDRIVER, NVMFDRIVER, etc.).
For this reason, the Cyborg agent should invoke these drivers
via py-spdk to communicate with the backend SPDK-base app server.
The py-spdk is management lib for SPDK applications which need to
be imported into the cyborg, the import.yml add the operation.

For example:
When the Cyborg agent call the NVMFDRIVER.discover_accelerator(),
the return value we get is:
{
    'server': 'nvmf_tgt',
    'bdevs': [{
       "num_blocks": 131072,
       "name": "nvme1",
       "block_size": 512,
       ......
     }]
    'subsystems': [{
       "core": 0,
       "nqn": "nqn.2018-01.org.nvmexpress.discovery",
       "hosts": [],
       ......
     }]
}

Change-Id: I2d0e4dc6b58e725584d22ee85961877a870c68a7

Change-Id: I2d0e4dc6b58e725584d22ee85961877a870c68a7
'}, {'created': '2018-01-29 16:47:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add Cyborg SPDK Driver

SPDKDRIVER is a virtual interface which provides common methods
for specific drivers (such as: VHOSTDRIVER, NVMFDRIVER, etc.).
For this reason, the Cyborg agent should invoke these drivers
via py-spdk[0] to communicate with the backend SPDK-base app server.
The py-spdk is management lib for SPDK applications which need to
be imported into the cyborg, so we modify the requirements.txt to
make it done.

For example:
When the Cyborg agent call the NVMFDRIVER.discover_accelerator(),
the return value we get is:
{
    'server': 'nvmf_tgt',
    'bdevs': [{
       "num_blocks": 131072,
       "name": "nvme1",
       "block_size": 512,
       ......
     }]
    'subsystems': [{
       "core": 0,
       "nqn": "nqn.2018-01.org.nvmexpress.discovery",
       "hosts": [],
       ......
     }]
}

[0] The implementation of py-spdk is subbmitted to
https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/379741/, please visit it.

commit_message:
Add Cyborg SPDK Driver

SPDKDRIVER is a virtual interface which provides common methods
for specific drivers (such as: VHOSTDRIVER, NVMFDRIVER, etc.).
For this reason, the Cyborg agent should invoke these drivers
via py-spdk[0] to communicate with the backend SPDK-base app server.
The py-spdk is management lib for SPDK applications which need to
be imported into the cyborg, so we put the pyspdk lib into cyborg/
cyborg/accelerator/drivers/spdk/util/. There are some unit tests
we added in cyborg/cyborg/tests/unit/accelerator/drivers/spdk/.
Now We are first implementing the unit tests of
test_discover_accelerator() and test_accelerator_list(),
and the rest will be added later.

For example:
When the Cyborg agent call the NVMFDRIVER.discover_accelerator(),
the return value we get is:
{
    'server': 'nvmf_tgt',
    'bdevs': [{
       "num_blocks": 131072,
       "name": "nvme1",
       "block_size": 512,
       ......
     }]
    'subsystems': [{
       "core": 0,
       "nqn": "nqn.2018-01.org.nvmexpress.discovery",
       "hosts": [],
       ......
     }]
}

[0] The implementation of py-spdk is subbmitted to
https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/379741/, please visit it.

Change-Id: I2d0e4dc6b58e725584d22ee85961877a870c68a7

commit_message:
Drop django_openstack_auth related code

In Queens cycle, the code of django_openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repository. The master branch of django_openstack_auth
will be retired. (horizon blueprint merge-openstack-auth)
This commit drops django_openstack_auth related code from DevStack.

_prepare_message_catalog_compilation in lib/horizon was used only
in install_django_openstack_auth, so it is dropped too.

Change-Id: If9467c520a1e07d1968b29e485df0097330356bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 00:44:46.000000000', 'message': 'CentOS: Fix EPEL mirroring and RDO install on CI nodes

CentOS tests have reverted to using upstream for EPEL rather than
local mirrors, introducing some unnecessary instability.  The root of
the problem is that /etc/nodepool/provider disappeared with zuulv3, so
we now always re-install the EPEL repo and overwrite the local EPEL
.repos files that were made during test setup and point to local
mirrors.

The other change is that we stopped installing the RDO repositories on
the testing nodes too.  That we were incorrectly taking this path and
reinstalling EPEL has hidden the removal of these packages from the
base image in the test, since it ends up installing them too.

Split the install into two parts -- epel and RDO.  Check for
/etc/ci/mirror_info.sh (the sourcable mirror script provided by base
test setup) and if so, just enable EPEL so we get the CI-mirror
version correctly.  Install the RDO repositories (if not already
installed) unconditionally.

Change-Id: Iccb045a6695deb10da4d68a5694e1fa45ccbb810
'}, {'created': '2017-12-04 00:51:35.000000000', 'message': 'CentOS: Fix EPEL mirroring and RDO install on CI nodes

version correctly.  Install the RDO repositories (if not already

Change-Id: Iccb045a6695deb10da4d68a5694e1fa45ccbb810
'}, {'created': '2018-01-14 21:24:19.000000000', 'message': 'CentOS: Fix EPEL mirroring and RDO install on CI nodes

CentOS tests have reverted to using upstream for EPEL rather than

The other change is that we stopped installing the RDO repositories on

reinstalling EPEL has hidden the removal of these packages from the

Split the install into two parts -- epel and RDO.  Check for
/etc/ci/mirror_info.sh (the sourcable mirror script provided by base

Change-Id: Iccb045a6695deb10da4d68a5694e1fa45ccbb810
'}]
commit_message:
CentOS: Fix EPEL mirroring and RDO install on CI nodes

CentOS tests have reverted to using upstream for EPEL rather than
local mirrors, introducing some unnecessary instability.  The root of
the problem is that /etc/nodepool/provider disappeared with zuulv3, so
we now always re-install the EPEL repo and overwrite the local EPEL
.repos files that were made during test setup and point to local
mirrors.

The other change is that we stopped installing the RDO repositories on
the testing nodes too.  That we were incorrectly taking this path and
reinstalling EPEL has hidden the removal of these packages from the
base image in the test, since it ends up installing them too.

Split the install into two parts -- epel and RDO.  Check for
/etc/ci/mirror_info.sh (the sourcable mirror script provided by base
test setup) and if so, just enable EPEL so we get the CI-mirror
version correctly.  Install the RDO repositories (if not already
installed) unconditionally.

Change-Id: Iccb045a6695deb10da4d68a5694e1fa45ccbb810

subject: Temporarily relax validation of 'mounts'
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-04 19:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-02-05 01:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-02-05 01:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-04 19:38:04.000000000', 'message': "Temporarily relax validation of 'mounts'

We currently restrict the 'mounts' parameter to be one of the
following forms:
1. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx}
2. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx}

However, the python-zunclient sends the following:
i. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'size': ''}
ii. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'source': ''}

Either i and ii is considered to be invalid because it matches
both #1 and #2. However, the valid request should matches either
The long term fix is to make the python-zunclient stop sending
empty string to server.

Change-Id: Id8ffc5d783923c2783565b6d019b250feae2031d
Partial-Bug: #1747282
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily relax validation of 'mounts'

We currently restrict the 'mounts' parameter to be one of the
following forms:
1. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx}
2. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx}

However, the python-zunclient sends the following:
i. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'size': ''}
ii. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'source': ''}

Either i and ii is considered to be invalid because it matches
both #1 and #2. However, the valid request should matches either
The long term fix is to make the python-zunclient stop sending
empty string to server.

Change-Id: Id8ffc5d783923c2783565b6d019b250feae2031d
Partial-Bug: #1747282

commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I157703a9ae9bea99c1219367f7225ce60a530803

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122834.html'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-29 14:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have switched to Zuul v3 now, this change does not apply anymore.

Learn on how to update your change with Zuul v3 at
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html .

Simplified:
* Job definitions can be in-repo; common job definitions are in
  openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repository
* Job scheduling can be done in-repo for project specific changes,
  common jobs are configured via
  openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml

Read the above mentioned document for finer details.

Please decide whether this change is still needed and then adopt if
for Zuul v3 or abandon it.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-02-05 01:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

The simple way is not calling agent_rpc._update_firewall_group().  OVS rule registration is done in handle_port() in l2 agent side.  Current code is as follows:

1. handle_port_create_event()
    * call set_port_for_default_fwg() -> fwg port association has changed
    * call update_firewall_group_state  -> status has changed into "PENDING_UPDATE"
    * call agent_rpc._update_firewall_group() -> call update_firewall_group in agent side and raised OVSFWaaSPortNotFound  and status has changed into "ERROR"
1. handle_port() at agent side
    * Newly created VM port is not registered fwg_port_map so OVS rule is applied.
    * Then, the status of fwg which is associated the port has changed into "ACTIVE"'}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2018-02-02 01:23:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Thanks An. I think we can remove the code to check the CfgOpt for auto associate default fwg. IMHO u can keep it simple and remove the check in addition to the existing changes here we can address other associated cleanup separately in R.

Few minor comments to be considered.'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Remove disable option for default FWG and allow only on VM ports

Currently, auto associate default FWG works only one time and the logic
is broken if the new port is a DHCP port or router port. This patch
fixes the problem by validating if a port is a VM port or not,
ignores port binding failed or unbound and also adds trusted port
handling. In addition, for security perspective,
'auto_associate_default_firewall_group' CfgOpt is no longer used.
Automatic association with default firewall group with VM port
works by default.

Closes-Bug: #1746404
Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA<y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury<chandanc@juniper.net>

retype.

commit_message:
Fix session persistence update

The QoS patch[1] broke the ability to update the session persistence on a pool.
This patch fixes that issue and increases test coverage for these updates.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/458308

Change-Id: Id357c1e00a6a13d2194cd9382cafb220cf373410
Story: 2001419
Task: 6122

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I457d43504128269bef4346c5fc0cc64c9d77e965

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-15 14:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'Disambiguate the hacking rules for third party imports

There is some inconsistency across existing code in whether OpenStack
projects such as oslo and neutron_lib are considered "third party" or
"project imports". This commit clarifies the guideline.

If the popular sentiment is the opposite of what I've written then
I can change the wording to say that, but either way the style guide
should state clearly whether "other" OpenStack projects are "project"
or "third party".

Change-Id: I6d89eefdef9f3b594a65aa73b7464bbc1f18306d
'}]
commit_message:
Disambiguate the hacking rules for third party imports

There is some inconsistency across existing code in whether OpenStack
projects such as oslo and neutron_lib are considered "third party" or
"project imports". This commit clarifies the guideline.

If the popular sentiment is the opposite of what I've written then
I can change the wording to say that, but either way the style guide
should state clearly whether "other" OpenStack projects are "project"
or "third party".

Change-Id: I6d89eefdef9f3b594a65aa73b7464bbc1f18306d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 23:42:44.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
(cherry picked from commit 236bb54493385bcfe2034e8b0fd7a387fa66635a)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
(cherry picked from commit 236bb54493385bcfe2034e8b0fd7a387fa66635a)

currently be easily and cleanly rectified, we should disable voting

commit_message:
Mark multinode job as non-voting

As the mutlinode job is failing and is failing in ways that cannot
currently be easily and cleanly rectified, we should disable voting
for the job until we are able to fully identify the cause and proper
solution in order to allow the project contributors to continue to
land code and have it reviewed while we work to resolve the multinode
grenade job issues.

Change-Id: Ie3502bd46d45795319e5d3ee157ffc39e44070f8
Related-Bug: #1744139

commit_message:
Add new zuul executor metrics

This adds starting builds (builds which have not yet run their
first playbook), and percent available memory.  Both of these are
used to control whether new jobs are accepted.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 11:01:34.000000000', 'message': '[RFC] fpga driver support

This patch is not a plugin implementation

Cyborg agent can call driver as follow:
from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga import util
from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga import base
venders = util.discover_vendors()
for v in venders:
    dr = base.FPGADriver.create({"vendor": v})
    dr.discover()

intel = base.FPGADriver.create({"vendor": "intel"})
intel.program("/fpga/device/path", "/local/path/image")

Co-Authored-By: Dolpher Du <Dolpher.Du@intel.com>

Change-Id: I132be5ecdb90b385b68b0cdf306d1402ef4bfc04

'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 07:24:38.000000000', 'message': 'fpga driver support

This patch is not a plugin implementation

Cyborg agent can call driver as follow:
from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga import util
from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga import base
 # There maybe more than one vendor fpga card on a host.
venders = util.discover_vendors()
for v in venders:
    dr = base.FPGADriver.create({"vendor": v})
    dr.discover()

intel = base.FPGADriver.create({"vendor": "intel"})
intel.program("/fpga/device/path", "/local/path/image")

When call IntelFPGADriver.discover(), we can get the result as follow:
    [{'assignable': False,
      'devices': '0000:5e:00.0',
      'function': 'pf',
      'parent_devices': '',
      'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.0',
      'pr_num': '1',
      'product_id': '0xbcc0',
      'regions': [{'assignable': True,
        'devices': '0000:5e:00.1',
        'function': 'vf',
        'parent_devices': '0000:5e:00.0',
        'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.2',
        'product_id': '0xbcc1',
        'vendor_id': '0x8086'}],
      'vendor_id': '0x8086'},
     {'assignable': True,
      'devices': '0000:be:00.0',
      'function': 'pf',
      'parent_devices': '',
      'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.1',
      'pr_num': '0',
      'product_id': '0xbcc0',
      'vendor_id': '0x8086'}]

Cyborg agent call use it to form it's DB.

Co-Authored-By: Dolpher Du <Dolpher.Du@intel.com>

Change-Id: I132be5ecdb90b385b68b0cdf306d1402ef4bfc04

Co-Authored-By: Dolpher Du <Dolpher.Du@intel.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-01-31 05:53:49.000000000', 'message': 'FPGA driver support

This patch is not a plugin implementation

Cyborg agent can call driver as follow:
from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga import base
fdriver = base.FPGADriver
 # There maybe more than one vendor fpga card on a host.
venders = fdriver.discover_vendors()
for v in venders:
    dr = fdriver.create(v)
    dr.discover()

intel = base.FPGADriver.create("intel")
intel.program("/fpga/device/path", "/local/path/image")

When call IntelFPGADriver.discover(), we can get the result as follow:
    [{'assignable': False,
      'devices': '0000:5e:00.0',
      'function': 'pf',
      'parent_devices': '',
      'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.0',
      'pr_num': '1',
      'product_id': '0xbcc0',
      'regions': [{'assignable': True,
        'devices': '0000:5e:00.1',
        'function': 'vf',
        'parent_devices': '0000:5e:00.0',
        'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.2',

      'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.1',
      'pr_num': '0',

commit_message:
FPGA driver support

This patch is not a plugin implementation

Cyborg agent can call driver as follow:
from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga import base
fdriver = base.FPGADriver
 # There maybe more than one vendor fpga card on a host.
venders = fdriver.discover_vendors()
for v in venders:
    dr = fdriver.create(v)
    dr.discover()

intel = base.FPGADriver.create("intel")
intel.program("/fpga/device/path", "/local/path/image")

When call IntelFPGADriver.discover(), we can get the result as follow:
    [{'assignable': False,
      'devices': '0000:5e:00.0',
      'function': 'pf',
      'parent_devices': '',
      'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.0',
      'pr_num': '1',
      'product_id': '0xbcc0',
      'regions': [{'assignable': True,
        'devices': '0000:5e:00.1',
        'function': 'vf',
        'parent_devices': '0000:5e:00.0',
        'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.2',
        'product_id': '0xbcc1',
        'vendor_id': '0x8086'}],
      'vendor_id': '0x8086'},
     {'assignable': True,
      'devices': '0000:be:00.0',
      'function': 'pf',
      'parent_devices': '',
      'path': '/sys/class/fpga/intel-fpga-dev.1',
      'pr_num': '0',
      'product_id': '0xbcc0',
      'vendor_id': '0x8086'}]

Cyborg agent can use it to form it's DB.

Co-Authored-By: Dolpher Du <Dolpher.Du@intel.com>

Change-Id: I132be5ecdb90b385b68b0cdf306d1402ef4bfc04

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I12a78cf935e78ea4117150bb8a14fa30637bcd7c

commit_message:
aggent support resource tracker for FPGA

use PeriodicTasks to track resources.

Info:
 https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.service/latest/reference/periodic_task.html

Aggent is a bridge for FPGA driver and conductor.
It gets the lastest informations and update them to conductor.

This patch we call conductor API directly instead of object
remotable method.  Will support it in the next version.

This patch depends on the FPGA driver patch and conductor patch.

How to test this patch:
1. apply the fpga driver patch
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531129
2. generate a sysfs fpga data
   $ ./cyborg/tests/unit/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/prepare_test_data.py
3. Change the SYS_FPGA in cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/sysinfo.py to
   "/tmp/sys/class/fpga"
4. change the SYS_FPGA_PATH in cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/utils.py to
   "/tmp/sys/class/fpga"
5. restart agent.

The unittest for this patch will be in a separated patch, and comes out ASAP.

Co-Authored-By: Dolpher Du <Dolpher.Du@intel.com>

Change-Id: I5e487cf939aa65d0fc79399ddd5d1337a8c2fa98

commit_message:
Implement FPGA data model and corresponding API

This patch implements the Deployables data model and provides corresponding
CRUD REST/RPC API.

Since the CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE method of Deployables should only be used
by internal component, currently keep these in code is just for convenient
test purpose, which will be removed later.

blueprint cyborg-fpga-modelling

Change-Id: I8a028954bd27d015c0b062f730673ea39701774d

commit_message:
Disable Elasticsearch NFS snapshot repository by default

This disables the Elasticsearch snapshot repository backed by
NFS by default as the curator job for snapshots is disabled by
default, and should make no assumption that NFS is deployed by
default

Change-Id: Idc74cfb80fcb4c4741d82c6d0ce63fd90a8c919f

subject: Retry event actions
messages:
[{'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2017-12-20 08:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2017-12-21 00:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-01-08 21:43:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am not sure about this approach. If there are race conditions, shouldn't we prevent them instead?"}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-09 04:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I am not sure about this approach. If there are race conditions,
 > shouldn't we prevent them instead?

Thanks, Pierre. There are naturally some race conditions between some actions like updating while starting. So I introduced the status checker (included in I014aba977e5203bb72e055d08716f84ff76015cc) to prevent data inconsistency. The status checker blocks the following action, e.g., if a user try to update a lease while starting the lease, it denies the update request and the user is expected to resend the update request later. I think it is natural and good behavior.

However, if the sequence is opposite, i.e., if the following action is an event action like the start_lease, there is no way to retry the event action and the lease falls into ERROR status. This is unacceptable behavior.

I think introducing "retry event actions" is a simple and resilient solution for this problem. How do you think?'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-11 06:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-18 09:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

The phrase, "race condition", confuses the problem. The problem is just event action doesn't wait an end of previous event.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

Thanks for your comments, Masahito!'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-23 11:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-24 04:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-24 04:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-01-24 06:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-02-01 20:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-02 01:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-02 01:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

Thank you, Pierre!'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

wait others comment and will merge it in one day.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-02-04 15:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Retry event actions

An event action fails if the target lease is at a transitional status,
e.g., trying to start a lease while updating the lease and it fails.

This patch adds capabilities for retrying such an event action.
A new configuration variable 'event_max_retries' is added with this
change.

Change-Id: I34c8f1816660e4aa92404459d8908bf707785d0f
Implements: blueprint event-retry

commit_message:
Remove unused jenkins/scripts/run-tox-* scripts

We converted some jobs to Zuul v3 native, remove now unused scripts:
* The run-tox-api-ref.sh script is obsolete for some time, remove it.
* the tox-with-X scripts, they are not used anymore (see dependency)

Change-Id: I296102a5fdd0ecf688ed5ae68fa061577814ccf7
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540586

Remove legacy with-X-master tox periodic jobs

These jobs have been migrated, remove them.

This needs a lot of editorial fixes. Listing those aren't too constructive, please just fix double spaces and punctuation. There are some grammar issues as well.

On the constructive side I'd say this is a very difficult task. In general the ideas here seem fine to me, but I'll need to think more about possible race conditions and general convergence of such distributed system."}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2017-11-21 11:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2017-11-22 06:54:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

1. As mentioned in others comments - needs syntax/editorial fixes.

2. The 'NetworkPolicy' to security group mapping is not clear to me ,from the document. I would consider adding a table to describes  mapping of 'NetworkPolicy' fields to neutron security group.

3. Does this design covers all types of neutron ports (direct port -SR-IOV ? )?

4. How multi network interfaces support  and 'NetworkPolicy' design - work together ?


 The"}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-11-26 13:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-11-27 07:34:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Yossi Boaron -thanks for the review 

following your question: 

1. Hope that is better now (thanks to irenab for the editing!) 

2. the section that start in line 85 descirbe the mapping between policy to security-group , it's not in table format but it's covers all fields. 

3. It's should attach security-group to port , same behavior as the current default security-group. I think it's depend if networking back-end support security-group on special interfaces 

4. what do you mean by multiple-network ? Can you refer to spec ?
(I found that  - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TW3P4c8auWwYy-w_5afIPDcGNLK3LZf0m14943eVfVg/edit?ts=58877ea7 , but i don't think that implemented yet in k8s ..)"}, {'account_id': 24604, 'date': '2017-11-28 09:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-11-28 13:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2017-11-30 15:07:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hi Eyal,

Welcome aboard !

1. Regarding the multi vif per POD I meant to this one :
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/513715/9/doc/source/devref/vif_handler_drivers_design.rst .

It seems that it will allow creating multiple VIF's per pod, and multiple VIFs means multiple neutron ports.

So your design is about translating  K8S pod<-->network policy relationship into neutron port <--> security group .
So need to bare in mind that a single pod may be represented by multiple neutron ports."}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2017-12-03 06:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

@Yossi: Regarding the SR-IOV VIF, the support for security groups is very limited, and most of the chances the Network Policy is not going to be supported as is for them. I would suggest to apply Network Policies for the main/default VIF only. This will support the only case that is supported by native K8s, since it does not support multiple VIFs right now.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2017-12-03 07:24:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

@Irena, Thanks for clarifying.
I agree that we should focus on default/'normal' VIF at this phase.
IMO,we should take into consideration other use cases (multiple VIF's per pod , and other VIF types) at least at design level, BTW I'm fine with adding comments/assumption notes to spec."}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-12-14 11:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-12-14 11:44:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Change in spec :
1. don't use the separation between namespace selector  and pods selector they behave exactly the same 
2.Use on same security groups for all queries in same rule  
3.use tags instead names (as we anyway can't do nothing with the name) , just the UID matter 
4. Added section of assumption"}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-12-14 13:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2017-12-20 10:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(4 comments)

Hi Eyal!

Looks good to me ,
I've added few minor syntax/spelling comments."}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:55:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1

The spec LGTM. That said, I'm still a bit concern about all the options/translations (with possible corner cases) as well as the performance impact that a lot of calls to neutron may have, both on kuryr as well as on neutron side. We need to dig a bit deeper on the tradeoffs of adding rules to specific security groups vs creating new security groups. Even though the second is cleaner in most situations,  the first could improve performance quite a bit on some actions (like when adding a new label to a lot of pods)."}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:58:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-30 07:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+1

(8 comments)

Hi Eyal,

Overall LGTM ,
Please see the syntax/spelling inline'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:24:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

(19 comments)

I think that the design is fine in the big picture. Inline I've mostly pointed out some rst formatting/rendering issues and added some questions that come to my mind."}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2018-01-31 16:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2018-01-31 16:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2018-01-31 16:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

[{'created': '2018-01-16 12:05:29.000000000', 'message': "Use virtualenv to builid kuryr-cni Docker image

This commit changes the way we produce kuryr-cni Docker image.
Previously we've distributed the kuryr-driver as py2exe binary that
contained Python 3 interpreter and all the dependencies. This binary was
called from CNI. That approach had some disadvantages, the major being
complicated build procedure.

This commit implements distributing kuryr-driver as a virtualenv with
kuryr-kubernetes and all the dependecies installed. That virtualenv is
then copied onto the host system and CNI can easily activate it and run
kuryr-cni binary.

Change-Id: I65b01ba27cbe39b66f0a972d12f3abc166934e62

commit_message:
Use virtualenv to build kuryr-cni Docker image

This commit changes the way we produce kuryr-cni Docker image. Previously we've
distributed the kuryr-driver as pyinstaller binary that contained Python 3
interpreter and all the dependencies. This binary was called from CNI. That
approach had some disadvantages, the major being complicated build procedure
and having to see false-positive BrokenPipeError tracebacks in kubelet
logs.

This commit implements distributing kuryr-driver as a virtualenv with
kuryr-kubernetes and all the dependecies installed. That virtualenv is then
copied onto the host system and CNI can easily activate it and run kuryr-cni
binary. This should solve issues caused by pyinstaller.

Closes-Bug: 1747058

Change-Id: I65b01ba27cbe39b66f0a972d12f3abc166934e62

subject: Experimental - DO NOT merge
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-28 12:54:51.000000000', 'message': 'Experimental - DO NOT merge

Pass storage nfs VIP to ceph-ansible

This VIP is needed in ceph-ansible to tell ganesha service
to listen on this IP only.
This parameter is passed through the endpoint map, it could be
done also by passing allNodesConfig to ceph-ansible (addressed
in patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509146/) and then getting
this value from allNodesConfig in tripleo-common ceph-ansible workbook.
Disadvantage of this alternative approach is that any parameter
change would require also change in tripleo-common.

Depends-On: I1262faef895df0023a225ab10dfe66dfb3d3efba
Change-Id: I98fbcf17dfd3e59187d48f5255723f2544ad070d
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha
'}]
commit_message:
Experimental - DO NOT merge

Pass storage nfs VIP to ceph-ansible

This VIP is needed in ceph-ansible to tell ganesha service
to listen on this IP only.
This parameter is passed through the endpoint map, it could be
done also by passing allNodesConfig to ceph-ansible (addressed
in patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509146/) and then getting
this value from allNodesConfig in tripleo-common ceph-ansible workbook.
Disadvantage of this alternative approach is that any parameter
change would require also change in tripleo-common.

Depends-On: I1262faef895df0023a225ab10dfe66dfb3d3efba
Change-Id: I98fbcf17dfd3e59187d48f5255723f2544ad070d
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha

subject: Experimental - Do not merge
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-27 14:36:04.000000000', 'message': "Experimental - Do not merge

Add support for ceph-nfs manila backend

If ceph-nfs (ganesha) service is enabled, it's set up by ceph-ansible
and it can be used as a manila backend. Manila can be configured to use
ceph either directly (manila-cephfsnative-config-docker.yaml env file)
or through ganesha (environments/manila-cephfganesha-config-docker.yaml
env file).

Depends-On: I1262faef895df0023a225ab10dfe66dfb3d3efba
Change-Id: I2dde3eab123a0e634549ea9f825fb2341a0e9b93
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha
"}]
commit_message:
Experimental - Do not merge

Add support for ceph-nfs manila backend

If ceph-nfs (ganesha) service is enabled, it's set up by ceph-ansible
and it can be used as a manila backend. Manila can be configured to use
ceph either directly (manila-cephfsnative-config-docker.yaml env file)
or through ganesha (environments/manila-cephfganesha-config-docker.yaml
env file).

Depends-On: I1262faef895df0023a225ab10dfe66dfb3d3efba
Change-Id: I2dde3eab123a0e634549ea9f825fb2341a0e9b93
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha

commit_message:
Add enough notification for QoS

In order to meet the needs of users, add 'created_at' and
'updated_at' in logs. The following interfaces are modified: create,
update, delete, delete_keys,
associations (List all associations of given QoS specs.),
associate (Associate a QoS specs with a volume type.),
disassociate (Disassociate a QoS specs from a volume type.),
disassociate_all (Disassociate a QoS specs from all volume types.).

Users can search log information from different angles according to
the notification information.

In addition, add an interface that converts the datetime format to
date in utils.

Closes-Bug: #1569150
Change-Id: I7c05330f108989bf2e8b4b2a2ba8b8428eeee2e7

[{'created': '2018-02-03 15:11:49.000000000', 'message': "Use new periodic tox with-master jobs

Replace use of legacy jobs with new Zuul v3 jobs.

Remove the extra timeout, it should not be needed since the tox installs
are now done at setup time - and the normal unit tests don't need it

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540586

commit_message:
Use new periodic tox with-master jobs

Replace use of legacy jobs with new Zuul v3 jobs.

Remove the extra timeout, it should not be needed since the tox installs
are now done at setup time - and the normal unit tests don't need it
either.

Change-Id: I0aa18852755adeb695382362900686d93f0f32e8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540586

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 15:32:39.000000000', 'message': "Expose serial keyword to base-test playbook

Now that zuul supports a single shared ansible_host in inventories,
add the ability for a user to use the serial keyword on our base
playbooks.

When using multi-host inventory files, all of the tasks happen
independent of each other on separate hosts. With a share ansibe_host,
they will end up fighting with each other. One way to avoid this, is
to set the serial keyword to 1, and host will run tasks one at a time.

By default, if base_serial is not set, we'll omit the serial keywork
in the playbooks.

Change-Id: I532939c843e7f6f6a7d29beb84ef523d25536bb3
Depends-On: I674d6baac26852ee1503feb1ed16c279bf773688

commit_message:
Expose serial keyword to base-test playbook

Now that zuul supports a single shared ansible_host in inventories,
add the ability for a user to use the serial keyword on our base
playbooks.

When using multi-host inventory files, all of the tasks happen
independent of each other on separate hosts. With a share ansibe_host,
they will end up fighting with each other. One way to avoid this, is
to set the serial keyword to 1, and host will run tasks one at a time.

By default, if base_serial is not set, we'll omit the serial keywork
in the playbooks.

Change-Id: I532939c843e7f6f6a7d29beb84ef523d25536bb3
Depends-On: I674d6baac26852ee1503feb1ed16c279bf773688
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update the validation template for postgresql

Add some configuration options on valuation rules file,
these options are availables from the release 9.5 and 9.6

New options from 9.5:
 - gin_pending_list_limit
 - idle_in_transaction_session_timeout
Changelog:
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/10/static/release-9-5.html

New options from 9.6:
 - log_min_duration_statement
 - backend_flush_after
 - bgwriter_flush_after
 - checkpoint_flush_after
 - force_parallel_mode
 - parallel_setup_cost
 - parallel_tuple_cost
 - replacement_sort_tuples
Changelog:
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/10/static/release-9-6.html

Closes-bug: #1745238
Change-Id: I89d793ccc7fa43deb3c1da7b23ce10cdf1e85c4d

commit_message:
Update the base class for application credential

This patch updated some base functions' input parameters
and documentation in application credential backend to
keep the same with the usage. So that the customer could
write their own backend easliy.

Change-Id: I5d090d3ab72ab1f31bf3c3edcb8f4429085829ed

commit_message:
Deprecated error method

$http's deprecated custom callback method: .error() has been
removed in AngularJS 1.6. Use the standard .catch() promise method
instead.

Change-Id: Ib95b6fd8ae053e606c78a71278ce9653004c2c5a
